text: Fun atmosphere. Good food. Big beers.  I would suggest the appetizer sampler (the works). As many below me will agree, the sauerkraut balls are delicious. The bier cheese & pretzels were good too.  I had the Bayerischer Schweinsbraten (pork with sauerkraut and a potato dumpling). It was different than I expected as I'm not too familiar with German food, but still pretty good. The pork was cooked well and had a good sauce. I wish I had substituted mashed potatoes instead of the dumpling.

Fun!  Great energy!    Its all about the beer people.....don't go looking for healthy food.  But you will find a good time and good beer....and its LOUD and jolly, so be prepared!  I was dining with Mom, so we opted for seating in the private dining room.  Big wooden tables, lots of great natural light from big windows.  We were offered seating on the patio too, which would have been really nice too.  We checked out the big hall when we were leaving and saw that there was live music and the entire room was alive and buzzing.  Looks like it would be great fun for a large group for a great night of drinking!

I am from Cleveland and went to this place because I enjoy great beer and food. We went for late lunch and had an excellent experience. German beer hall atmosphere is true to form with a guy on the accordion and dressed up beer wenches.   Food was phenomenal, beer was authentic german stuff from the Dunkel to the Hefewizen. We did not see the sampler on the menu but when one went by we ordered it.  We had the giant pretzel and the 3 dips bier cheese, ozabel (sp) and sweet mustard were the best (great lakes brew in CLE has slightly diff Ozabel).  My wife had a pan seared pork chop with burgandy mushroom sauce perfectly tender. The sauteed cabbage was spot on. I had the pork loaf which was like a hot dog flattened and grilled. great flavor. Views of the river were great and we even did the german drinking cheer that was made made very popular on the man show.

My first experience at this restaurant was hard to describe. We sat down in the great German hall and had high expectations since the atmosphere seemed so communal and unique.      It didn't take long for the tides to turn on the 'seat yourself,' 'cafeteria style' seating as a server never seemed to appear to take an order. We may have been less apt to judge had a server granted even a simple drink order. But we sat to wait for at least twenty minutes. On the brink of trying the Irish place across the street, we were finally greeted by an apologetic hostess.     When the food and beer finally arrived (wursts on a bun and a liter, for me) we thoroughly enjoyed the cuisine. After the orders were taken there was hardly a wait for the food to arrive. The bill followed suit. The food was wonderful for the portions and quality.  I would probably try this place again on a week night, as we ate in on a Saturday.  It might be less crowded and more enjoyable.

Visiting from Oregon and decided to see what Pittsburgh had to offer for breweries. This place was great!! The service was great! The view was great! I could go on.......... It was kind of slow when we were there so we got to take it all in. The size of the hall was impressive then we went outside and the was huge also. It would be fun to see it full. We did have some beer cheese fondue with pretzels. Very good and filling.

Excellent service, great food, and of course great German beer hall atmosphere.  This place is even better when their beer garden is open because it gives you a quieter option if you don't want to be in the hall.  Monthly beers, to me, are a hit or miss, but they are nice about bringing you another beer of your choice if you don't like it.  Everyone should do a shotski.  I don't care how corny it is but it's so much fun.  Wursts are good.  Also had the Southside Sampler, which was OK.  The cheeseballs were too salty for my liking.  The potato pancakes were great.  OMG I don't know what they're called, but the french fries with cheese and bacon and some sort of green herb were delicious and not heavy.  Highly recommended.  Also highly recommend the streusels.  This place is very crowded during weekends.  I would recommend coming here on weekdays or getting here early.

We arrived shortly after 8, to a line.  We waited, and when we checked in with the hostess, we gave our cell number and were told it would be a 30 minute wait.  An hour and 15 minutes later, we were still waiting.  I went in and asked again how long it would be, and a second hostess said that the kitchen backed up, and that they just started seating again, and it would be another 20 minutes.   I wish someone had told us from the outset that they weren't seating, and that the estimated wait was over 90 minutes. We would have went elsewhere instead of waiting around.  Or, since they did have our cell number, someone could have sent a text explaining the situation.   Needless to say, we never did try the food because we didn't want to wait any longer just to be seated....from the complaints of others that we could over hear, food was taking a long time as well.  If the kitchen can't handle the volume of orders coming back, perhaps they shouldn't seat so many at one time.  I understand that things happen, but you have to be up front with customers, and not let people wait way longer than they are expecting to with no explanation.  Seems like it would be a good place, but this situation left a sour taste in my mouth, and I doubt we will return.

Do you like great beer at a reasonable price and in large quantities ? Do you like awesome German food and atmosphere?  Do you like pretzels that are soo big and delicious it hurts your very soul to see it disappear right before your eyes? IF SOO! Come and get it

Good authentic German food.  Authentic German beer.  Don't go here for a "hop bomb" - the beer the waitress described as "hoppy" did not have any detectable hop flavor (at least to this hop head).  The atmosphere is loud - I hope you like accordions!  Great restaurant, just don't go thinking you're going to have conversation with your dining companions.

As far as beer garden type places go, this place is pretty standard.  They've got plenty of beer and lots of hearty german fare.  The only reason I'm not giving 4 stars is because I feel like there's nothing that screams AMAZING!!    I feel like you mainly come here for the ample seating and lively atmosphere.  The pretzels we had were pretty good, but again, nothing amazing.

We love going Saturday and seeing the Bavarian Brats! Always try to grab a table up front, it's just not the same at the bar or at a booth in the front room. Just squeeze your way in if you want to have a fun night. Thursday night is college night and I hear the specials are great (half off beer.)  I recommend a stein of any beer, they're all good, especially the hefeweizen and any seasonal specials, and the appetizer sample plate, which has a ton of snacks to share for cheap. I'm always surprised at how cheap you can spend an entire night here.
Great service and sooo much food! Had a really good time here. Save room for all the food you will be served!

If you're looking for a quiet, romantic dinner by candlelight - well, this . . . this ain't it.  But if you're looking for scrumptious German food (bratwurst, bierwurst, currywurst, pretzels, etc.) and classic German beer in a beer hall setting with accordion music, staff in lederhosen, dancing, and lots of happy patrons you will be crazily happy!  Throw in the sizeable outdoor biergarten and a lively, picturesque river scene - and this is a really nice slice of nice!
Good food, beer land music. As authentic as you're going to get in the U.S. I recommend keeping it simple. Get a beer and some pretzels and call it a day. Maybe a side of sauerkraut too.
This place is huge.   It's a little overwhelming when you enter the place but the food quality and beer easily makes one feel comfortable and at ease.

I have lived in Pittsburgh for nine years and have always loved coming to the Hofbrauhaus, so now that my boyfriend and I are moving away, we decided to host my birthday party/ our going away party outside in the beer garden by the river. For the most part, we had a lovely time, enjoyed a nice atmosphere with good food and drink and decent service and it was the right venue for hosting all the friends we've made over the last 9 years.  But I feel compelled to add that the end of the evening was unpleasant. I should preface this by saying that my boyfriend and I and most of the friends who were there with us met or currently work in food service and are respectful and understanding of business hours and closing procedures at other establishments. We knew ahead of time that the place closed at 1am, and we had every intention of being ready to go at 1am. But starting at midnight, the wait staff started taking drinks away left and right, rabidly clearing our tables if we dared to look away or visit an adjacent table. Then at 12:30, I was told I had missed last call and I couldn't get another drink. Fine -- I didn't need one anyway, but keep in mind my last one had been taken by an overzealous busser while I was hugging someone goodbye.  At 12:45, we were reminded that we had 10 minutes left to finish our drinks. "Great, thanks!" we said, planning to comply. At 12:50, a wall of security guards more or less stood around us, and they brought a police officer over to cross his arms and pretty much just scowl and stare intimidatingly at us as we tried to say our last goodbyes to good friends, which, to say the very least, put a damper on the festivities. I got the sense they were looking for any excuse to kick us out.  If you advertise your hours as being 11:00 am - 1:00 am on a Thursday night, then I think it's only fair to allow your customers to enjoy themselves until the announced closing time. Don't strong arm your customers into leaving before then. We weren't being drunk jerks, we weren't trying to order a lot of food or shots or anything, we were just trying to finish our drinks and say our goodbyes, but the waitstaff and security team just surrounded us with death stares for the last 20 minutes of the night. Had it been 1:15, I'd have completely understood and would have rounded up any oblivious revelers as quickly as possible as part of a cooperative and sympathetic effort, but that was not the case.  If not for that, I'd have given them a 5-star rating, but "last" impressions matter, too.

The atmosphere is certainly festive and everyone I went with said the beer was good (esp at that price). I am pregnant and can't drink so I can't comment. Ordered the Jaegerschnitzel- breaded cutlet "with a bacon, mushroom, and red wine sauce". The sauce was bland and there was no sign of the bacon, wine, or mushrooms. The cutlet was so overcooked the meat was gray. Ordered a side of mashed potatoes- bland and institutional tasting. I really enjoyed the German potato salad- not sure how authentic it is though! Definitely not the best German food in PGH and there are better (albeit chain) options if you're restricted to the SouthSide Works.

The bar staff here is top notch. Especially Liz! She is a true pro, provided excellent service even under a high demand situation.  Highly recommend the place just based off service alone. The Dunkel is a fantastically balanced and satisfyingly malty brew, grab one. You're welcome.

My friends bachelorette party: we told them we had a party of 10, they sat at us at a table for 8, the waitress told us we could pull up chairs. The manager told us we had to move tables halfway through our meal. My friend had a verified state id, they did not accept it and did not let her drink, the nachos were good, but my salad was drowned in dressing, the waitress never asked me what dressing i wanted.  The waitress forgot to enter my friends food. I fond he short blond haired manager in her 40's offstandish and  very unhelpful! Really bad! They didnt even give her a discount even though they forgot her food. Also this is a college bar where all the students loudly stand up in their chairs and start chanting the taylor swift song by the band! Really annoying and you cant hear anyone in your party!

I have spent years in Germany. There's nothing like good German food and this is nothing like good German food. Go for the beer and the building but eat someplace else. The beer hall is attractive and authentically replicated. The outdoor seating is superb and has some of the best waterfront views in Pittsburgh. The food is a disappointing : everything seems to be breaded and deep fried and bland tasting. Even the German potato salad was lackluster. They might be better off cutting back on the number of menu offerings and significantly improving the quality of the food. Otherwise I suggest forget about eating here and just order beer and maybe a German pretzel or two.

The food was very good . The service was good too. I couldn't believe how cheap the beer was.  My boyfriend and i had some sort of German chilly fries which was really good.  We also had the giant pretzel.  So good.

I threw an engagement party for my best friends in one of the private rooms at the Hofbrauhaus.  Kelley Williams helped to assist in planning the function and was amazingly easy to work with, quick and super professional.  She made sure that on the day-of, everything was exactly what we discussed.  The buffet menu looked and tasted fabulous!  The servers who were assigned to wait on my guests were very gracious, fun and made the evening go very smoothly.  I don't have one negative thing to say about my experience hosting a party here.  Kelley and her staff made it the perfect experience and I would definitely have another party at this restaurant!
Very good restaurant with good food and beer, but it is ruined by awful wait staff. Service is very rude

Went here on a recommendation from a friend. Couldnt have been happier.  All the beer was top notch. All the food was very good, Kinda hard to mess up a hotdog or a brat but they definently couldnt have made it any better. Some what of a gourmet hot dog! LOL. Service was very good as well. Thank you ROB(Bartender)!  Me and my girlfriend loved it and will definently be back!

This is one of my favorite places in the Pittsburgh area I've been here numerous times.  The draft beer is always good but don't except a ton of choices to be on tap all at once.  Don't listen to the negative reviews by the annoying foodies and hipsters.  I mean seriously are they ever happy?  They build a place in Pittsburgh that does not revolve around sports and TV's yet they still complain.  The menu has all sorts of things on it and I love the German potato salad and the red apple kraut.   The place can get really busy and loud though so if you're the type of person that is turned off by that I recommend trying to go when it is more low key.  In the warmer months there is outdoor seating that is used but in the colder months everyone is inside.

I wish, I wish, I wish we had one of these in St. Louis.  First, apparently this is actually a replica version of the actually Hofbrauhaus that they have in Germany (so my friend who actually went said). So. Pretty cool on that front. Thankfully, there aren't drains in the floor of this one like there are for the one in Germany...  They're a German beer hall so so course you have to get the beer steins. They're pretty big. Each stein is probably about 2.5 cans of beer.   The food is decent. The pretzels with cheese are actually really good. Get them. I also got a plate of spatzle with chicken breast, and like everything else here, the plate was huge. I finished it all but I don't know how I did it and I kind of wished I hadn't. Later, we got the ski shots, which are basically just 4 shots on a ski and you have to drink it all at the same time.  The atmosphere in the beer hall: you either love it or hate it. It's rowdy. It's loud. There's people standing on benches. (Surprise revelation of the night: Sweet Home Alabama is apparently a popular song in Pittsburgh.) They do have a great beer garden outside for when the weather is nice and you just want to get it away from all the ruckus inside.  For dessert, we had the apfel strudel and the chocolate layer cake. I really liked the chocolate layer cake though it was at the point in the night when I probably could have cared less what was for dessert.

I've only been here once, but I honestly wouldn't recommend it. The wait for a table was long, the place was packed and noisy, and the atmosphere was just annoying (loud drunk people chanting 'USA', god knows why because it's not an American-themed bar).   I ordered a beer and some food, which was chicken and potatoes. Everything seemed really overpriced. When it came out, it was pretty bland and boring, except for the excitement of finding a large lump of plastic in my mashed potatoes. I alerted the wait staff who told me that the potatoes come in bags that are sliced open, and some of the cut-up plastic must have gotten into the meal. The staff were super friendly and replaced it, but it was still a bit of a let-down.  Maybe it would be nicer to go in at lunch time and have a beer and a pretzel or something. For dinner though, I definitely won't be going back.

This place is really great! The food was excellent, the waitress was very nice, and the atmosphere was pretty cool. There was even a man playing the accordion as the entertainment. He would take song requests for tip money! I wished he would've played my song request "Schnitzelbank". I want my $2 tip back. That's ok, my family and I still enjoyed the visit anyway. This is a fun place to eat!

Live music, fast and polite service, delicious food. I went with Hofbrauhaus Wurstlplatte (grilled bierwurst, bratwurst and frankfurter with mashed potatoes and sauerkraut). Very fresh, cooked to perfection. Also, I went with a sampler of their draft beers. I did like their premium lager but other beers seemed flat to me.

The few times I've been, I have not been impressed. The service has been slow, orders gotten wrong, and the food just isn't that great. I'm not a big beer drinker, but the people I know who are like the selection. It is fun to have polka-esque live music. I would be fine eating home-made German food and not going back to Hofbrauhaus.

Strictly from a tourist's perspective, I think Hofbrauhaus is excellent. I can see how for locals, it might get on your nerves a bit, but as an out-of-towner, this place hit the spot.   We went there twice (embarrassing?) - the first time on a weekend night. The outdoor seating in the back was perfect for drinks and pretzels/beer cheese. We were there for a few hours, and it was relatively uncrowded (although it's huge, so there were probably a lot of people there). People really do stand on benches and sing along with the band in the inside area, but if you are looking to spend time in a place where you can hear yourself talk, the beer garden was perfect.   We went back the next day for lunch, mostly because we loved the beer (the Oktoberfest is delicious) and we wanted to sit outside with a view of the river.  The food was heavy, probably not ideal for a hot summer day, but the rest of the experience was great.   The whole thing is a little kitschy, what with the "authentic" (?) Bavarian outfits donned by the serving staff and the accordion player strolling around the joint. And there was a significant influx of college age club-hoppers getting their night started. Also be prepared to get ID'd at every corner regardless of your age. But honestly, none of those factors affected our experience at all - we even bought a souvenir Hofbrauhaus mug to take home.

Can't say enough about how much I enjoyed the beer. The good was food but the portions were actually a little too big (one portion would have been enough for my wife and I). This is a better place for large group or family than a quiet date night, but it's fun.

Love this place - no matter the weather!  I have been here in summer and sat outside with a good view, and in winter and stayed inside and admired the authentic beer hall style.  They offer seating outside in their enclosed porch with a muted view of the river.  It was plenty warm enough!  The beer I tried, a season wheat, was excellent.  So far, every meal I've had was delicious. Recently, I had their dessert, and that was fantastic!  The chocolate cake was rich, moist, and something I wanted to live in lol!

Such a fun place! The sauerbraten, pretzels and potato pancakes were delicious. I had the lager, which was a good beer. The entertainment was really fun, especially after 9 when everyone was standing on the benches and singing along with Steve Grkman. Go with a group of friends, this place is super fun! Recommend to anyone looking for a casual, but energetic experience.

Although only 4 year round beers and 1 rotating tap, beer is solid and cheap (less than 6 bucks for a half liter, less than 10 for a liter).  The pretzels are delicious, and the potato soup is awesome.  I would only go when weather is good enough for outdoor seating because it is on the river and has a great view, also because inside is too rowdy with a lot of drunk assholes in the beer hall.  It gets so bad on weekends that police officers wait outside for any issues that arise in the beer hall.

What is not to love?   Excellent food, excellent service, entertaining music!  Sing loud with your beer in the air, stay late and dance on a table.  Celebrate with a "shot"-ski.  Great time every time I have gone.  Only con is it's pricey.   We love this place!

I am not a big fan of the original HBH in Munich, but the HbH in Pittsburgh is quite authentic. It can be very loud in the main hall, just like Munich, the food is OK, just like Munich, it is a good place to drink a lot of beer, and it is a wild time.  However, the HbH Pittsburgh gets high mark for having a wonderful beer garden patio, a heated terrace, and a private and quiet dining hall.

+ delicious Bavarian fare and brews, + nice patio with a scenic view, - packed and noisy inside  If you are looking for a typical Bavarian Oktoberfest experience the Pittsburgh Hofbrauhaus branch gets very close. Despite the TV screens showing sport events the interior reminds of the original Hofbrauhaus in Munich.  Similar to the interior the menu is Bavarian and convinces with delicious brews and traditional Bavarian and Southern German fare, some of them with an American twist. Make sure you try the battered and fried Sauerkraut balls and the Hofbrau Dunkel beer!   Besides German Oktoberfest Classics the live bands are playing popular American songs to which the crowd starts dancing after their first "mass" (a liter of beer).  If you prefer a less busy atmosphere the outside patio with scenic views over Monongahela River is a great alternative during a nice summer evening.  Average price for an entrée: $15, price for a "mass" (1 liter of beer): $12.  + nice location + scenic view from the large patio + good Bavarian fare and beer - noisy and packed indoors

Food was good, waitress was attentive, but nothing noteworthy.  For a slow Sunday night, we sat in the "quiet" hall that faces the road.  When the room is large and currently seating only 4 other parties, its furstrating to sit so close to others when the rest of the room (out of ear shot) is going to waste.  They definitely need to adjust the thermostat.. A 40ish degree night in Pittsburgh dictates furnace usage, not expecting patrons to sit and enjoy their meal whole wearing their coats.

Possibly, my favorite bar in America!  Excellent Hofbrau Beers, solid food, great setting, especially the Beer Garden on a nice day.  This is a beer hall....so if that's your thing, you will love it here.  Great beer cheese pretzels, and the German food is very good.
Great beer, great Schweinshaxe. Absolutely the place to celebrate Oktoberfest.

Meh.  I've experienced better.    I'm amazed by the size of this place.  Indoor hall, outdoor beer garden, inside, outside, upstairs, downstairs, lots of chairs, everywherez!  We've come here several times for big get togethers, and I think that's the best upside.  They can easily accomodate large parties, and the waitstaff does a pretty good job in keeping up.  The food itself, though, is just bleh.  I guess I'm just not into German cuisine.  I mean if Heidi Klum is the pinnacle of German beauty then Hofbrahaus is like the Janeane Garafolo of Deutschland dinners.  Then again, they do have a great selection of beer, and Germans know beer.  So put down a few of their pints, and Janeane Garafolo may just magically transform into Heidi Klum! #beergoggles
Great food. The pretzels, red cabbage and bierwurst are fantastic!

Great food, great atmosphere and yummy beer. We took our three young kids who really enjoyed the love music (yodeling!) , soft pretzels and bier cheese . My husband and i also both adored our meals. I wish I could remember what they were. He had a sausage sampler. I had the fried pork with ham and bier cheese. Yuuuuuuuuuuuuum!! We're from out of town but wish we could come here all of the time!!!
A great atmosphere for a drink and German food. If you're visiting the Pittsburgh area you should check it out.

Great beer and authentic German fare.  A very good option for big groups - they can handle it.  Generally busy.  Not the place to go for vegetarian options, although they might have one or two.  It is very nice for kids.

Yum!  Good german food Friendly service Beer brewed on site Clean bathrooms  What more could you dream for  My husband would eat there every day if he could  Gluten friendly menu.  It is a menu of avoidance not replacement.  It lists things that naturally have no gluten rather then gluten free products shaped in.  Sorry no GF beer but they have other drinks.  Load but quite out side on the terrace.  It is heated but drafty so bring a sweater if you want sit out there.

The food was excellent.  The entertainment played our two favorite German songs back to back.  The manager opened up the gift shop for us to buy souviniers even though it was closed. Would definately go there again.

Good beer but average service. Warm pretzels and cheese makes a good appetizer.  We went there for lunch on Sunday, party of five: 1. Reuben Sandwich- Good, lots of meat of course 2. Grilled Chicken Sandwich- Yummy, good amount of chicken and fries were fresh and crispy 3. Baby Spinach Salad- Not so good, some of the ingredients such as caramelized onions were missing 4. Chicken Ceaser Salad- OK 5. Southside Chicken- Satisfying and vegetables were good.  Worth trying, if you like good German beer.

Disappointing. Come here if you like extremely crowded and loud places, mediocre, heavy food, and staff that only care about their next table. This place has forgetten what it means to respect each customer's business, even those trying to enjoy a family visit - since it doesn't have to.

Food is delicious, atmosphere is fun, and staff is friendly. Great place to go for a good time. I had the schnitzel - it was out of this world! Definitely try the beer cheese and pretzels as an app, but skip the fried pickles.. Also, make sure you.sit in the room with the performers.

On a bike trip with my family, we thought to stop and grab some beer and fried stuff before the trip back. We ordered, and my 30 year old brother, his 29 year old wife and I (25 years) were asked for identification. My parents were with us and were not carded. We told them we were biking so we didn't have our wallets, and told them our ages, and our dad confirmed we are adults. The waiter wasn't having it. My dad said, "okay cool we'll just get liters then" and the waiter took the order without comment. My parents shared their liters with us, and the manager came out and said "though I can see that you are old as you say, I'm afraid we cannot serve you alcohol and have to ask that you not drink any." So much for an authentic German experience.  Also the food's gross.
The Hofbrauhaus is the ultimate experience around Pittsburgh if your into German style food. The food is great and the atmosphere is unmatchable.
Loved the Beer Fries. Slightly pricey. Super friendly service. The atmosphere is very welcoming, making it very suitable for family or dates.

Love this place. Great location with beautiful view of the river. Great beer and a lot of choices on food. It can get crowded so be prepared for a 30-min wait. Service is wonderful and they offer to text you when the table is ready.   Nice place to go for country music lover. I went on a Saturday night and some bands played country music. People all stand on the chairs to sing and dance. Great atmosphere. Can't wait to go back.
This is must when visiting Pittsburgh. Come on Saturday. Live music, dancing girls, and beer!!!

I don't know if it was the timing or what, but we had a great experience here. I got the Schweineshaxe (a favorite German food of mine) and it was absolutely amazing. Even people walking by our table to theirs asked what it was so they could order it. Fantastic.  Of course the beers were good too, and the view on the deck made for great atmosphere. The waitress had no problem with our taking time to eat our meal and have a few beers, and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves.

I have been there several times and I love this place. The German food is excellent and the Dunkel beer is awesome. The biergarten is a great place to hang out and have a drink right next to the river. I highly recommend the Hofbrauhaus.

I was in town visiting my fiancee's old stomping grounds, and we stumbled on this place.  I got the Sauerbraten and I'm still unsure if I liked it. It was like nothing I'd had before so was unique in that way. Just not sure if I like German food or not. I think I liked it. My fiancee and her father had some other dishes which they were quite pleased with, but the joy was the music. We were there on a Saturday night and there was an accordion band in the front singing their hearts out. They even sang Sweet Caroline, which being a Boston native I had to sing along with. and yet, there was a room full of Pittsburghers singing along! It was a blast.  They also had a special where if you ordered a liter of beer, you got to keep the mug, so I'll always have a memento of Hofbrauhaus in the form of an enormous mug.

Love this place!  It has the best food!!! the beer is very good!  Such a fun time, would reccomend going on a weekend night, the music is best then and so are the people :)  However I go anytime during the week, becuase I love the food and beer :)
Awesome German food! The atmosphere actually felt like a Bavarian beer hall, and the entire experience was great. The location on the river is also great, and it was wonderful to sit outside to eat.
The potato pancakes were great, the sausage was good, the beers were ok. I thought it was a bit pricey for the food offered. The interior was very good though.

I'm settling on three stars, because the experience really was pretty fun.  The place is a cavernous vault with soaring ceilings that reflect the loud, raucous vibe, the German music, and the clank of beer steins on tables.  Pretty cool.  I am  not above enjoying a kitschy appeal to every German stereotype, and I'm definitely not above the beer choices.  I think I might have just had the bad luck to go there when the waitress I got was having a bad day, because her negativity was so pronounced that I whispered to my dinner companion, "Did I do something offensive?  Why does she hate me?"  Hard not to have a bit of a pall settle over the experience when you're wondering if your server is spitting in your food for reasons you can't figure out.  Everyone else was great, though, so maybe that was just an anomaly.  The hostess was super cheerful, the musical entertainment was outrageous and fantastic, and it's basically a great place to go to if you're in the mood for a loud, cheerful time.  The one other challenge I experienced is that there's no nearby parking, so having someone with limited mobility in the party is tricky.

This review is just for my meal...nothing else. I admit I am not a fan of this place to go hang out.  Maybe if I was younger and lived close....but it's way to loud for me. I don't want to yell over the oompah band  the entire time I'm trying to hang with friends.  I'd find the music tolerable if I was drinking heavily. But people come here for the atmosphere knowing what they are getting into...so Im not going to rate this place based on my dislike for something that is at the heart of the business. So with all this being said...I had a good meal last week.  Had a gift certificate there and needed to wait out traffic. I got lucky coming in early in the evening because it wasn't the full band....considerably more quiet.  I ordered the Sauerbraten....really flavorful.  If you don't like traditional sauerkraut, this dish comes with red apple kraut.  Awesome.  My BF had the pork with crackling.  This dish is insane.  Wish I had taken a photo of it.  If you love pork and the fried pork skin....heaven.  For me it was a bit too much work to get the right amount of pork and the right amount of cracklin in each bite to make it nicely flavored. But if you have the time while drinking your huge liter of beer....then go for it.

Do not go to the bier Garten on a sunny Sunday of a holiday weekend. Service took literally hours and some items never arrived yet showed up on the bill. Go to the bar to order anything if the bier Garten is busy, and plan to be there for a long while. That said, if was lovely to be on the river on a sunny afternoon.
We automatically got the "chain/franchise" vibe when we walked in because it felt like a weird Disneyworld version of Germany, but it didn't matter because the food was spectacular.
First time at Hofbrauhaus and we will be back.  Delicious food, great service, very clean and accordion music.  What can be better.  We really enjoyed it.

I can't say enough about this place. I lived in Pittsburgh all my life and up until recently I discovered this gem! It is fun, plain and simple. The band is great and it makes your dining in experience seem like so much more than just dinner. Their beer is phenomenal and food is great as well. I got "the works" burger and I recommend it to anyone looking for a different kind of burger.   A little pricey, yes but I highly recommend to anyone looking for a different experience in the burgh!

Hofbrauhaus Pretzels And Bier Cheese / Soft Dough Pretzels + Bier Cheese Spatzle + June - Leichtes Weizen = two thumbs up! I've been here twice. FYI: loud audible music if you sit inside - in the main area (if you're into that) though pretty nice outdoor seating.

I visited the restaurant on a Sunday evening.   There was no line to get in but the place was full!  We we seated immediately in the covered outdoor area.   It was comfortable, quiet and had a gret view of the river!  Service was prompt and friendly (thanks Lucy!)  We got beer explanations and recoommendations and enjoyed the very short wait for the food.   I am a breaded pork cutlet  fan so i ardered the weinerschnitzel.   Wow....I was huge, hot, and delicious with not a drop of grease!  The sauce went well with the meat too!   I could have this dish over and over again!  Good food, nice surrounds, and good service AND you don't haveto be part of the boisterous party if you don't want too!

Ah, a bit of Deutschland here in USA. Beer is good (duh), food it depends on what you order. I was born in Germany and raised off schnitzels and wursts so I may be overcritical on some of their items, but the weiss wurst and sauerbraten are pretty good. What makes this place a great hang out for me is the biergarten .... 1. Awesome view 2. Lots of seats 3. Bathrooms close (lots of beer = lots of trips) 3. I can smoke cigars 4. great scenery.   Inside is load with music and people dancing. Always amusing to watch and take in the atmosphere. I plan on spending time here for the World Cup for sure.

Lots of good-tasting light beer options for those like me with a hops-averse tongue.  Overall the food is okay (bland schnitzels), but anything potato is delicious (potato pancake, German potatoes, fries, etc.).  Great atmosphere, despite the cheesy traditional German pub garb, and the views of the river on the deck are a nice reprieve from the high energy (read: noisy) inside.  I get the sense that the night life would be pretty fun at this establishment.
Absolutely awesome!!!!  Can't say enough positive. Service!!!! Food!!!!  Location!!!!  Love sitting on the river.

Go here with a group of friends because it's a party place. The food is great, German bier garden fare. Limited number of selections on tap, but I guess that is on point for a German bier garden. Did I mention drunk ladies dancing on the table to the house band playing Journey songs?

We came here as a group of eight on a Saturday night. Our waiter was very friendly and the food was very good. I ordered the schnitzel sampler. This place was very crowded and very festive. People were standing on the benches and singing with their beers as per the theme of the venue.  While this is not exactly my scene, I still have to give this place a thumbs up in terms of atmosphere, vibe, service, and food quality. If you are someone who likes a festive drinking partying atmosphere, then you will no doubt love this place.
Food is god entertainment is exceptional and prices are reasonable.  If you are staying in the area it is a must stop,especially if you are a beer drinker as they brew their own right there.
BE THERE EARLY!!! They serve limited amount of pork shank everyday. Be sure to get there around 5p to taste some! Like the beer, and love the idea of beer sample.

Great German beer, okay German food at reasonable prices in a humongous beer hall/restaurant/patio/bier garden. Live polka music every night in the beer hall which does get very noisy! The restaurant, patio and beer garden aren't as noisy. My favorite spot is the patio at night. The lighting that they use reminds me of an amusement park and you can easily have a conversation. Been here many times and the service has always been great. My only knock on this place is the food. I love German food but I wish they would put in as much tender love-n-care into their food as they do their beer.

On the last night of a trip, I usually tend to go to a place that I know will have good beer.  I have been to the original Hofbrauhaus in Munich.... so it was a no-brainer that I would end up here at some point during my trip to Pittsburgh.   It was a nice night, and the sun was just about set on a nice summer day.  A seat out in the Biergarten was an easy decision.  It was nice to see the old Oktoberfest tables set out with a nice river view.   To start off, we shared the pretzels and bier kasse.  Think about that.  Okay, you got it.  It was pretty much what you think it would be.  Definitely recommend.  I ordered the schweinebraten and my wife ordered the nurnberger sausages.  Unfortunately, they were out of the schweinebraten and I went with an order of the nurnberger sausages as well.  To drink, I had their seasonal Pilsner, and my wife had the hefeweizen.  Later on, I got a dunkel as well.  Everything came on in a timely manner, and tasted pretty much like what we have enjoyed in Deutschland.  The beer, as you would expect, was right on. After dinner, we split the appel strudel, which was very good.  The restaurant was in a great location.  It was right by a riverwalk, which came in handy as we tried to walk off the great meal we just had.  So.... where's the fifth star?  The party next to us asked for mustard and was given Guldens mustard.  While that wouldn't raise an eyebrow anywhere else, this is a German place and you have to get the mustard right.  It would be akin to putting ketchup on someone's noodles at an Italian restaurant.  But all in all, it was very faithful to the original Hofbrauhaus.  Definitely try to stop by here if you have a chance.  Highly recommend!

Love this place. Great service. Great food (try the apple strudel) and the beer is excellent!  I try to bring everyone I know here now just so I have an excuse to come.  A real German beer garden experience.

It is loud, the food is meh, the beer selection is surprisingly limited.  The only saving grace is its riverfront location and the views that that affords (when you are lucky enough not to be seated in the beer hall).  If you want great German food, and I mean really great, go to Max's on the Northside in what was Pittsburgh's Germantown.
Great installation of the Hoffbrau. Reminded me of Munich with good good, beer and a great view of the river.

I was there for the pork shank but unfortunately I'm told they didn't do it that day (or it was sold out, I don't remember). So I ordered a half chicken with cabbage and potato on the side. The portion is HUGE. I couldn't finish. Even though I was able to eat what I wanted but I enjoyed the chicken as well as the friendly and relaxing ambience. Good place for meeting group of friends.

Pretty loud and the food is good but not quite great although I guess the main reason one would come here is for some authentic German beer which this place delivers to perfection.  Fun, but not a place I would go out of my way to visit every time I am here.

We went on a Saturday night at one of the most packed times.  It's definitely an experience on Saturday's.  They have live music and there is a real camaraderie feel between you and your table mates.  It's always the first stop on our Saturday trip up and down the South Side.

There's not too much mystery as to what the Hofbrauhaus is at this point: huge, rambunctious beer hall with German and Not-German-At-All food offerings.  So I'll just offer a couple of thoughts to optimize your 'Haus experience:   1. Outdoor seating is great on warm days/nights.  So what if the Mon River is often sludge brown?  I still get mad at how criminally undeveloped Pittsburgh's riverfront is.  This is one of precious few spots to actually hang out by the water and I'm a fan.   2. The Weizen is legitimately great.  For beers like this, freshness is everything, so getting bottle versions from Germany definitely lose something on the trip over.  And for whatever reason American microbreweries haven't really mastered this style.  So this is a legit German recipe and it's fresh.  Short of going to Munich it's hard to get better.   3.  Definitely recommend the monthly keg tappings.  Fun time and you get to try out the new offering for free in addition to seeing how they used to do kegs in the olden days.

Came here on a friend's recommendation. After paying for (mandatory) valet parking, we went in and asked for a table for two. Hostess looks at me as if I am off my rocker for thinking that we could get seated for dinner (at 9 pm!) and says, "We aren't taking names any more tonight, but if you want to wait about an hour, we switch to open seating."  Open seating, as she further explains, means that at that point, we will have to wander the restaurant looking for an empty table, fight our way to it, hope no one else grabs it before we can get there, and then wait to have a server notice us.   We took one glance at the frat-boys and already-drunk cougars and decided to try one of the other places near by.   I don't care if they have the best German food on Earth (and looking at the priorities of the clientele, I'm guessing they don't) such lousy service is not going to win my business when there are so many other options in this town.

Best place to party!! European style...  They have an amazing view of the river. And if you are here on a weekend night, you are in for a treat with their Dance on the tables!!  You will forget all the stress.
I love this place! Great food and great atmosphere.  I love the live music, I look forward to that every time I come.  I also enjoy the monthly beers, I usually try that and am never disappointed.
Delicious!  Traditional food and beer. Brings back fond memories of Munich & Bavaria.   Service was very professional and friendly.   We will return again!  Auf Wiedersehen!

The food is nothing special but I will keep coming back for the beer.  The Hefeweizen is my personal favorite.  I am not that into the band or the raucousness going on in the main room but I do enjoy hanging out in the beer garden.  It is a great place to take a break from a bike ride.

If your not German.. you are walking into this wonderland!! Its impossible not to smile and I have a blast every time I visit. I must order the potato pancakes every time.. so good.   I recommend ockoberfest.. its a really good time.

I used to always come here but probably won't anymore. I ordered a big beer for $9.25 and paid a cash tip to the bartender. When the charge went through on my account it came up as $19.25. Apparently someone wrote in a $10 dollar tip on the charge slip. When I called to get it refunded the manager was rude about it and when I stated "My beer was only $9, why would I tip $10?" She said rudely, "Well I would because I am in the service industry." Seriously? Come on. The next manager that got on the phone was pleasant and refunded me quickly.   Not saying this will happen to everyone but it's definitely something to look out for.
Good food, great environment. Really smart addition to south side works. Really like that it's right on the river as well.

Ok so I gave this place five stars based on it's atmosphere and it's unique look inside and outside the building. Also for its awesome beer selection. The food is mediocre at best at least that's my opinion. They have a band here at night and its located in a very nice and safe area which is in the South Side Works of Pittsburgh. I recommend going at least once to try out their huge 52 ounce glass of beer it's 10 bucks by so worth it.

Pretzels and bier cheese. Do it even if you don't think you want them. Amazing. I love the schnitzel sandwich and their spaetzle. The food here is delicious, probably the best German in the city. But we all know that everyone comes for the beer. Hefeweizen is my go-to. Live German music and you can stand on the tables to sing a little Sweet Caroline. And an outdoor biergarten. Definitely a great time and perfect for my large group of drunk, rowdy friends.   The location makes it difficult to reach if you're bar hopping the rest of Southside (without driving and parking in one of the Works' garages). And it was way more fun here when shot skis, a legit Oktoberfest and less intense bouncers were a thing. 2010 Hofbrau would have gotten 5 stars.

A bit too crowded for my likes, but the selection of beer was very broad. The food accompanied the beer very well. The atmosphere was fun, seemed more for the younger crowd. Definitely a tourism spot if you're new to Pittsburgh.

A great German beer hall. The food is authentic, but they have selections for the people who are not fans of German food. Had the sausage meal, it game with 3 different types of sausage, mashed potatoes and sauerkraut. A meal that very filling and at a great price. The giant soft pretzel comes with 3 dips, cheese, stone ground mustard and a horseradish sauce. Atmosphere was very "polka friendly" with live music. I hear that it gets a little rowdy at late night. Well worth the visit !

Looks like a great summer hangout.  Unfortunately, we went late on a cool Monday evening, so not exactly peak time.  We went too late for the kitchen to be opened (and missed out on the free birthday item), and so I didn't look too hard for vegan items on the menu, but it looked heavy on sausages, so perhps not too promising.   I choose a dark German beer - Dunkel - but it proved to be pretty bad, and left a nasty aftertaste (dish water, anyone?) - not at all what I expected from a German, and for this reason I can only give it 3 stars.  The birthday girl had a Manhattan, and that was much cheaper than you might pay elsewhere, so that was a surprise.    Would I go back?  Probably, but I'd be trying a different beer for sure, perhaps the monthly special.  But avoid the dark one.

We took our boss to Hofbrauhaus yesterday for lunch to celebrate her birthday at my suggestion, because we often have alumni events here and have always had a good time.  We had a group of eight and were seated on the deck since it was a gorgeous day.  We arrived and were seated by 12:15.  After waiting 10 minutes, a waitress appeared and asked if anyone wanted drinks.  I ordered a Diet Pepsi and my coworkers all stuck with water.  The waitress left and we waited.  And waited.  And waited.    At 12:40 when we still had not ordered, I went inside and flagged down a busboy, explaining that we were on a limited schedule and had not even gotten drinks yet.  He apologized, grabbed a waitress, and immediately came to take our order.  They said they had gotten crushed all the sudden and assured us our food would be out right away.  At 12:45 (half an our after we had arrived)  they finally brought my soda and said again our food was on the way.  At 1:05 when we still had not gotten any food or seen our server, I once again went inside and flagged down a bus boy, saying that we would need our food packed to go as we no longer had time to eat.  He promised it would be taken care of right away.  At 1:10 our waitress brought out a birthday sundae with a candle in it, which-- while incredibly thoughtful-- was not helpful since we still had not gotten out meals.  She said again our food would be out "soon" and I said again that we needed it to go.  We also asked for our checks.    At 1:15 we were finally given our checks (though we still had gotten any food) and discovered that the checks were incorrect.  We paid the incorrect checks anyway because by then we were starving and late.    At 1:20-- over an hour after we arrived-- we finally got our cold food to go.  This was a terrible and embarrassing birthday experience.  We ended up eating cold food in a meeting because of this.  There was no adjustment to our (incorrect) checks.  Despite working across the street from here, none of us will be back any time soon.

Dirndl, lederhosen and bier cheese---oh my! I visited this place on a Friday night and it was an experience. My friend forewarned me how packed this place gets but I wasn't prepared whatsoever. We got there around 7P and got a booth on the side-perfect for the people watching spectacle to come. Got the bier cheese and pretzel appetizer and I wish I could have sucked it up with a straw but inevitably it would have gone right to the booty. Plus I don't think sucking liquid cheese through a straw is socially acceptable?   Then the band started along with a Pens game playing on tv and yeah, the place was madness. I've never seen a place like this before with peeps standing up on their chairs, dancing, drinking and have a merry ole time to Neil Diamond and John Denver jams. And seeing I'm originally from FL and never got into hockey, it was an experience watching a hockey game in the Burgh. The crowd was out of control with security strategically placed throughout the hall ready to break up a fight at any moment (hooray for no crazy frat boys trying to show how ballsy they are!)  When we had to get up to use the restroom, we had to take a few minutes to plan the best route in order to avoid dancing or beer spillage.   Service was ok.....the waitress disappeared for a good while and I don't blame her. Food was good but priced a little too high. Mixed crowed with people of all ages but lots and lots of kiddies. I think it would be a fun place to go to in the summer time with the huge patio they have but other than that, it would be a one in a while kinda place for me to go to. But regardless, still a fun time. Next time, Shot-ski is on the agenda.

I've never been to Germany, but i recognize the company logo from travel shows and even the amazing race. So of course I had to go!  Because I was in town to assist a family member go to the hospital, all I could do was go for takeout. First impressions about the ambiance, when you step inside you kinda feel like your in a dream... you see the vats they use to make beer, wooden interior, german music, and pretty waitresses in german outfits. Went straight to the menu and ordered a pork shank and  breaded pork chop. While waiting for the order, people and families were all smiles enjoying their beers and meals. When it comes to food, they both tasted great, though i strongly recommend the pork shank! The saurkraut and coleslaw delicious.  I just wish driverless cars existed already so I could try out their beers as well before driving back.

Hofbrauhaus is a great spot to spend a night out. The highlight is the freshly brewed beer served by the liter at quite reasonable prices. I forget exactly how much a liter is, but it's less than $10, which is a steal for beer of this quality. All the beers are spot on, I've never sampled any of the food but it seems great for drunk munchies. Service is friendly and fairly efficient, even on crowded nights.  The crowd varies from rowdy college students to tamer, older groups, but it's never unpleasant and there's always seats to be had if you don't feel like standing with your beer. The outdoor area is lively yet relaxing during the summer, there's nothing quite like enjoying a stein (or three) looking out at the river and skyline.

The main hall was only filled 25% ... and we couldn't have a conversation  over the accordin player.   The soft pretzels with bier cheese were good.  Our meals were dense/filling ... but none of us would order our meals again (ham Turkey potato pancake in bier cheese or the pork cutlet breaded with sauerkraut x 2).  The Apple strudel was recommended by our very knowledgeable waitress ... it didn't rise to the occasion.  The beer is served at room temperature so the flavors are not lost  ... aka no frosted glass on a hot day ...   We finished our meal and went out to the beer garden ... the river breeze was lovely and we weren't screaming to have a conversation.  Overall ... not impressed
A super fun experience every time! Whether you're with family or friends you can always have a good time at Hofbrauhaus. Their service is great and the staff is also great.

I only stopped by briefly for a beer, so I'll keep this review short.  It was my first time going to a Hofbrauhaus restaurant and to a beer garden in general. My first impression was positive. It's a perfectly situated restaurant in Southside Pittsburgh along the Monongahela River. The combination of 1 liter beer mugs, waterfront and waitresses in Dirndls made for a jolly good time.  The environment is very conducive to casual outdoor group drinking. The outdoor area is large with numerous tables. I'm guessing the capacity of the beer garden is close to 150 people. So it's a great place for group parties as well as for taking out of town guests like me who have never been to a beer garden before.    Beer was good I guess, but nothing spectacular. At the time, it was more about quantity over quantity. I didn't get a chance to sample the food, but judging from other tables there are definitely a lot of nice options that go well with beer. Service was pretty average, but waitresses in Dirndls is a plus (maybe?).   As I mentioned before, it's a great place for the occasional group outing. However, as another reviewer mentioned, it definitely carries a huge element of novelty. It's not your neighborhood bar and is not a real cozy place to grab a drink. With that said, I will be back to try the food if I am ever in town again.

Great beer!  Worst service I've seen in a while.  Will be calling the GM on Monday.  I'm too old to be treated like I'm in a college bar.    I would IMMEDIATELY ask Alexander if he wants to even be employed there.  Then start his new hire orientation again.    He wasn't the only bad apple.....just only name I collected and the worst offender.  Maybe it's his manager's fault?

Love the litre of Dunkel and the nice soft pretzels to go with all that beer! Nice, festive atmosphere -- what one would expect in a place like this. Absolute chaos on the weekends, however, I prefer weeknights and the outdoor patio for an excellent view of the river.

OK was here on business and we walked in from the street and sat down at a table. It was a Monday night so not busy at all.. Inside is the old German arrangement of the large wooden tables and benches, very heavy, hard to move and seat about 4-6 on each side.  It is also a loud place due to acoustics I think......Also with the table/bench arrangement, If someone wants to get up and in the middle of the bench 2 or 3 people will have to move.  We ordered the German Sausage plates and they were pretty good.  There were 3 kinds on the plate. Smaller than other restaurants but still were very good.  Of course lots of German draft beers and the large ones are HUGE and excellent.... Service was just OK.. not friendly but we weren't ignored.  The recommendation I have though, is before  you sit down, walk around and check out the areas to sit.  If it is nice outside (you know those 3 sunny days in Pittsburgh :-) walk around the back and you see beautiful views of the river and lots of outdoor seating; Covered and uncovered.  There is a huge seating area in a lower level also with benches and tables that I am sure is crowded on weekends with good weather and Oktoberfest.  There was 6 of us and we were disappointed we did not see the outside area before we sat down because that is where we would have been,  It gets a solid 4 and if there during warm weather would go and sit outside.
Awesome beer and food. Of course it doesn't hurt I love Bavarian style Hef and savory food!

I LOVE Hofbrauhaus!! The food is absolutely delicious. My favorite items to get there are the pretzels and beer cheese and their Chicken Marsala Spaezel. However, I have had their wurst and potatoes and that is wonderful too. They also have a great beer selection too! My favorite drink I've had there is their Oktoberfest. The best part of the Hofbrauhaus is their venue though. The inside of the building is the main restaurant/bar area which can get pretty rowdy at night. However, if you would rather have a quieter meal, you can go to the outside area which is picnic table style and overlooks the river. I went to the original Hofbrauhaus in Munich a few years ago and whenever I sit in the outside area, I imagine myself being back in Bavaria!

I love the Hofbrauhaus when it's not busy.  When they're busy, service can be an issue because the servers are overwhelmed.  However, when they are moderately busy, the food is good (Sauerbraten, baby), the service is good, and the beers are AMAZING!  I am particularly a fan of the hefeweitzen.

I went to Hofbrauhaus with my boyfriend and a few of his friends to grab a drink and check out the Pittsburgh nightlife.  The inside is surprisingly huge but has a very laid-back vibe.  The main hall with live music was packed so we found a table quickly in the quieter hall next door.  Most people around us were still ordering food, but we decided to just go with drinks.  I ordered a liter (yes, a full liter!) of their wheat beer, which was good (if not slightly warm towards the last few sips).  The beer was reasonably priced for the amount they served and overall, I had a great experience here.  Should have gotten a souvenir boot!

Ah German food, so simple in execution but yet the results are so pleasing.  For those that aren't familiar with German food, here's a crash course on what to expect:  generous helpings of meat, veggies, and beer.  The brand new Hofbrauhaus in Pittsburgh's Southside Works is no exception.    I've been here several times, both before and after traveling to the original Hofbrauhaus in Munich, Germany earlier this summer.  I'm happy to say that the experience here is as close as you can get to the "real" thing.  The beer hall is loud, you share your table with complete strangers, beer is served by the liter, and often times there is live German music (did I mention that dancing on the tables is encouraged?).  The food is very good and a great representation of the German style.  But what you'll really come here for is the beer.  Brewed on the premises under direction of the Reinheitsgebot (German Purity Law), they include a Lager, Light Lager, Dunkel, Weizen, and a seasonal brew.  At prices just under $8 per liter, it's a steal compared to other bars in the Southside.  Even if there a few Americanized touches here and there, it feels like an authentic German experience right in your back yard.  What more could you ask for?  Prost!
Wonderful atmosphere, large portions and great staff. The cheese dip is great and the beers are worth taking the time to enjoy. Over all it was an experience worth repeating.

There are plenty of places to drink beer in Pittsburgh... more than plenty... maybe even too many... OK  so you want to swill some brew from the Fatherland do ya?  My recommendation, go to the Fatherland.  This place is just silly.  The costumes the women wear are absurd.  The beer is only OK and the food is yucky.  My friend and I ordered soups... which never came.  My friend ordered the steak salad and I some spaetzle dish that was supposed to have "field mushrooms," Marsala wine, cream sauce, caramelized onions and chicken.   The mushrooms were basic and practically non existent.  The caramelized onions, if present, had disappeared into the cream goo entirely.  There wasn't even a hint of Marsala ... not a smidge ... not an iota.  The chicken was cooked to death.   I ordered a Hefeweisen to ease the pain and it was extremely herby tasting ... too much for my taste really... I asked for some lemon (yes you have to ask), and unsurprisingly, it too never came.  I elected to not drink the beer and try a dessert.  The strudel arrived in a sweet sauce with some raspberry flavoring.  It was piping hot because it was nuked into a pile of mush.  DISGUSTING.  I asked the waiter to remove the beer from the bill since I didn't drink it.  He had to ask the manager which seemed to bother him.  He took it off the bill.  The waiter was extremely handsome with a deep velvety voice and was the only fun thing (for me) about the experience.  Though his waitering could have been better his eye candy appeal was top notch.  Good place to people watch and drink, bad place to eat.  The appetizers sounded good but were crazy expensive for one person to order for themselves.

I'm sad to say that I was a little underwhelmed on my first visit to Hofbrauhaus. I saw the other location in Las Vegas, so on my recent trip to Pittsburgh, I made an attempt to visit this location. I was really hoping that the place would be more lively and a fun place to get a beer/ start off the trip, but unfortunately this was not the case. Maybe the place had a quitter atmosphere because it was 8pm on a Thursday?   I also thought the menu was very over-priced, which is to be expected at a gimmicky place like this. However, for a place that claims to be a German beer house, I was confused that the beer selection consisted of 5 choices, none of which were pumpkin flavored.    I'm still giving a 3 star review because the food and beer were good and my friends and I enjoyed ourselves, but had to say that I was a little disappointed. I'm open to trying the Vegas location the next time I visit though.

To be honest this is not my favorite place in Pittsburgh and I have not visited in a while-it is loud, the food/beer is not great and the German bands are annoying. On my last visit I was prepared to write a 2 star review but was surprised at the food and service.  In past visits the food has been horrible however on this visit I was pleasantly surprised how good everything tasted. We only had to wait about 15 minutes on a busy Friday night to sit in the main seating area. Our waitress was very prompt (not friendly but she was busy and quick to get our orders and food). I started with the large glass of the wheat beer.  This is not my favorite place for beer and it is just your average German wheat beer.  We went with the pretzels and beer cheese as our starter. I have had bad experiences with the beer cheese tasting like paste but this time it surprised me and was delicious.  For my entrée I ordered the club sandwich. I changed a few things on it and they had no problem getting my order straight. I choose the mashed potatoes as my side which were equally as tasty.  All in all a great place to have a drink on a Friday night with friends but eat before you come.

We were seated at the enclosed terrace, which was adorable with lights all over the ceiling. It would be a great place to sit at in the spring/summer when you can enjoy the breeze and look out over the lake.   When I looked at the menu, I didn't even bother trying to pronounce the names because I knew I'd butcher it and embarrass myself in front of the server. I pointed to the Bayerischer Schweinsbraten, which was pork roast with a potato dumpling and sauerkraut, while my boyfriend got the Schnitzel Weiner Art, which was breaded pork cutlet with cranberry sauce, potato salad, and cabbage. Both dishes were delicious and the meats were just really tender and flavorful. I loved the potato sides from both dishes; the potato dumpling was really savory and flavorful while the potato salad had soft chunks that had a sweet tinge to them.   You have to end your meal with the Apfel Strudel (apple strudel with vanilla and raspberry sauce ) and vanilla ice cream on the side.  It's not too heavy and it's great to share with someone else!  The food here is solid and you really can't go wrong by coming here.

Been to the original and this was a decent replica. It's definitely a plus to the area of Pittsburgh. It's right next to the river, so get an outdoor seat if weather permits.  It's a huge building and the portions are also huge (so share or bring a crowd).   The pretzel and beer cheese were great. The wursts were quite yummy and juicy. The bread dumpling was slightly too dense and dry. The pork roast was also a smidge dry, but maybe these items are better on other days. The apple strudel was similar to the one in Munich, but I can't put my finger on it...it wasn't as good (maybe the layers were too soggy?)    Please don't come here to get a hamburger...there are a ton of great foods to try.  Prices were good and the overall experience was great. I wasn't here for the music or anything, but it looks to have a fun setup.

Only restaurant I've ever been too that told us that they were too busy for us to order food when the restaurant is only 1/2 full.  It's a shame they didn't let us know before we paid for valet parking.  Usually love the Hofbräuhaus but very dissatisfied with this turn of events.  Poor planning?  I feel sorry for the servers.

Went here for college night. Lots of fun and cheap beer. Pretzels are to die for-- especially after a few rounds of beer. Very crowded though and expect to wait to get in and again to get a table. Good vibes

When the Schatzi said he was taking me to Hofbräuhaus for lunch last Sunday, I died a little inside. I immediately recalled the inedible meal that I had been served at Munich's Hofbräuhaus. Boy am I glad I kept an open mind, because I had a delightful time at this place!  First, our server, Karen, was the bee's knees! She was pleasant, attentive, and friendly. The food didn't hurt my feelings either. My boyfriend ordered the massive pretzel appetizer and he loved it. He's about the proudest Bavarian from backwoods Bavaria you ever did meet, so he knows him some pretzels if'n ya know what I mean! I ordered the cheese fries. I'm not a big fan of cheese sauce on my fries; I prefer the real deal! But these things were A-mazing. I could eat that cheese sauce by the spoonful. Also, when I asked for my Southern tzatziki aka ranch dressing, Karen didn't culture shame me. So gracious!! And speaking of the ranch, unexpectedly good -- at a Bavarian restaurant, no less!! Maybe even house made?  Now let's talk about that schnitzel. I had the Jägerschnitzel and it was awesome. It tasted pretty authentic, but what does authentic mean? I'd be lying through my teeth if I said I never had crappy schnitzel the whole time I lived in Germany, and I'm pretty sure all of those schnitzels -- even the less tasty ones -- were made by Germans. The schnitzel was not heavily breaded, which I prefer. The hungry Bavarian sitting to my left said that, although his schnitzel didn't taste authentic to him, he didn't care because it tasted so good.  It's a regional thing; an Oma in one town probably has a completely different prep style than an Oma in a town a couple clicks away.  To all ye hipsters, stop beating ye auld drumme of authenticity!  Since we're on the subject of hipsters, there was a noticeable lack of hipsters and young intelligentsia cluttering up the booths. Can I get an amen, praise Jesus, and a hallelujah all at once?!? It could be because Hofbräuhaus is a -- gasp! chain restaurant! Fine by me. The pleasure of a dining experience is inversely related to hipsters. Score!  Another score? The serving sizes should come with a warning. A skull and crossbones would be too severe, but perhaps a "consult a physician before..." could be helpful. Seriously, though, anything that saves this girl money and doesn't skimp on quality? Win-win in my book!  Would I go back?? No need to threaten me with a good time!

one of the best things to happen to Pittsburgh.  To start off we got the giant soft pretzel with the 3 dipping sauces.  all were phenomenal.  I guess i really liked the bier cheese because everything I ate here was smothered in it.  delicious.  Got the sampler with all the different beers they made.  Really liked their seasonal beer - got a whole litre!! THE MAD BAVARIAN was an awesome entertainer.  I would like to listen to more of his music, but i can not find him on a website - if anyone knows where i can listen to more of his stuff that would be awesome!  great German restaurant.  Would definately go back for the bier cheese !

I love Hofbrauhaus. It can get insanely busy during peak dining/bar hours, but I have also found it to be great for groups and for families. I've never had anything on the menu that wasn't delicious. The hefferveisen is my favorite from any brewery I've ever had. That said, you never know how long your wait will be and how loud it will be even it's it relatively early in the evening (four or five PM). Parking is annoying.

So we went with a group of friends at like 730 on a saturday night.  As expected the wait was about 45 minutes to an hour.  It wasn't too big of a deal, they texted and or called the designated cell phone when the table was ready, so we were free to roam.  After being seated, i perused their gluten free menu.  Overall, I was impressed.  I had the German sausages with sauerkraut and mashed potatoes.   Let me say, i was super skeptical because I actually don't like sauerkraut at all.  Well... I have been converted.   The food was excellent.  The sausages were moist, tender, perfectly cooked and deliciously seasoned.  The sauerkraut wasn't ridiculously sour and the potatoes were creamy clouds of goodness.

Look, you don't have to be a historian to understand the evils that Germany has been responsible for (and therefore I don't need to explain here). But there is an evil that has somehow eluded the iron shackles of shame....the evils of German food.  It is easily in the bottom 3 of ethnic cuisines.  So I guess that makes my review a bit biased.  But let me regale you with some truth, dear reader; WHOM AMONGST YOUR FRIENDS IS A GERMAN FOOD FAN?!!?! What's that I hear?  Crickets?  That's what I thought.  And I am not counting anyone who has friends named Hans or Helmut or Kurt etc...Beer cheese? Let the Italians and French handle cheese, let the Germans handle beer and roads without speed limits.  (Kraftwerk is my favorite German export, check them out sometime).  Potato pancakes are bland and unappealing.  The thing with pancakes is this....they're not good for you, even these starchy messes.  So if you're going to indulge, go whole hog and go to a breakfast place that specializes in them. (Don't you love how pancakes have escaped the wrath of dietitians and the public? It is a desert that has hitched its ride to breakfast.  What a scam, no wonder most of us get sweaty and out of breath just reading yelp reviews). German sausages!?!?! GO TO CURE AND GET GOOD PORK PRODUCTS.  THE GERMANS CAN'T DO PORK EITHER!!!    I guess Hofbrahaus was fighting with one hand behind their back in the first place.  Anyways...this is a fair to middling drinking place.  If you have out of town friends who come from a relatively rural or small town..they might enjoy the gimmick.     The beer garden itself is a pretty nice spot to enjoy beers on the weekend as well...so I have to acknowledge that.  But it is quite Bro heavy...so if that's not your scene, I get it.     IF THIS RESTAURANT WERE A MUSICIAN/BAND: Frankie Yankovic.  Polka is pretty bad by most measures, but old people and drunks  love it.  But they can't defend their love of it.

An enormous place that is perfect for bringing a big group to hang out at the tables.  Got a liter of hefeweizen and dinner was great, huge portions, and most importantly, they got the sauerkraut right, important for any German place.    Check out the gift shop too, the prices on souvenir stuff was a lot better than other places I've been to
I loved this atmosphere, people were singing along with the live band and the food was amazing.

The wife & I were in town for a concert and our friend recommended this place. We arrived on Saturday, shortly after they opened at 11:00. There was only one party ahead of us in the entire place.  The restaurant resembles a German bier haus, which my wife & I loved.  Waitress was very nice. We started with the beer sampler, five beers for $6.95. The beer is okay, nothing to brag about. We enjoyed the Octoberfest beer and the Dunkel.  We moved on to the sauerkraut balls. These things were awesome. If you are not offended by sauerkraut, you must try these. I then ordered the Hofbrauhaus Wurstlplatte and substituted sauerkraut for regular spaetzle. This is my third German restaurant and I finally found out the right way, how spaetzle is supposed to taste. The sausage was all very good. The wife got the Schnitzel Weiner Art.  The portion was huge so I was able to steal some of her food and it was fantastic. This place is great and cannot wait to return. We came for Judas Priest but loved the Hofbrauhaus...

They make their own beer and they have my favorite, Hefe Weisen.  The food was good, the beer was fresh and tasty, the musicians were drinking and playing.  The waitresses dressed in the German outfits just made it that much better.   They have a gift room with everything you can think of from mugs to shirts and candy. Very good.

Hofbrauhaus is about the experience, not the food. The music, the noise, the crowd and the overall ambiance make for a fun, festive place to celebrate or drink some over-sized beers.   Speaking of beers I am generally a fan of Hofbrauhaus' selection. The three standard selections (Lager, Hefe weizen and Dunkel) are all good (I have a particular love for the Dunkel). Be sure to check out the rotating specials. And if you aren't sure - ask for a sample or two (or three). The staff is great about this - they want you to enjoy your drink.  In terms of food: stick with german fare. Bratwurst, pretzels and such. Don't be surprised that Hofbrauhaus' salad isn't spectacular. Its a German beer garden, not Whole Foods.   Go with a group, sit outside on a nice warm day and drink a beer. Not much is better.
Nice Germanic environment, spacious seating.. Had pork shank & bratwurst plus beer, all great!

Went here a few times but this is my first review. Definately loud inside for a Tuesday. We ordered the pretzels and cheese, salmon, Pittsburgh steak salad and Wiener schnitzel. Everyone liked what they had; the portions were large; everything was hot; prices were a little high; and our waitress was pretty absent after the food was delivered. The service definitely could've been better. Overall it was a three star night.

I love Hofbrauhaus.  I went to the one in Munich and this one in Pittsburgh is very similar.  This restaurant has a very European feel, especially the beer hall and the outside seating.  The food and drinks were excellent,  Try the pretzels and have a Hefeweizen!

We came here on a Sunday night for a late dinner so it wasn't very crowded. There was a guy on stage singing most of the time we were there. He sang both German and cover songs. We started off with beers and the Oktoberfest pretzel - it was so good and I liked the different sauces that came with it. How do you top soft pretzels and beer? With giant pretzels and liters of beer.. can't go wrong with that combination. For dinner, I had the jagerschnitzel - pork cutlet topped with burgundy wine mushroom and bacon sauce and my boyfriend had the wiener schnitzel - similar to what I had minus the sauce. Both were really good and big portions.   Wish we could've seen what it was like here on a Friday or Saturday night.

Amazing food and atmosphere. A very jolly place that is loud and robust and an overall great experience. The food is delicious and the beer is unique and delicious. A bit pricey and hectic but absolutely fun!
The beer garden here is simply AWESOME.  They just do it right, great place to enjoy a big beer on a warm night.  Kind of out of the way, but come right in, down the stairs, and enjoy!

Pros: Beer was very good  Cons: Food tastes like frozen and what I can buy in the grocery store - expensive tourist trap  I was told if I were in Pittsburgh, this place is a must.  The service here was top notch.  We were a party of four and Chris was very attentive and knowledgable about the beer.  I got the sampler, which ran under $8 for 5 beers. What a deal!  They were all good.   The food was nothing special. The pretzel appetizer was too salty.  My pierogies tasted like Mrs. T's.  They were supposed to have bacon and chives, but all I got were pierogies with sour cream and onion straws.  We were there for the trivia night, which was enjoyable. During that, I got the nacho appetizer.  Again, nothing special.  The food is extremely overpriced for the quality.  You can phone in the German music and mead hall atmosphere, but it doesn't fix the food.  Go for the beer...after going to dinner at the Cheesecake Factory across the street.
Great atmosphere. Sauerkraut balls are delicious appetizer.  Parking is a little bit rough (hard to find a spot close by) awesome selection of draft beers to choose from.
Great German fare at reasonable prices! Wonderful ambiance and a great outdoor area, even in cooler weather.

Glad we went. Overall experience positive. Ambience at lunch less raucous than evening dining. Accordian player adds charm and is nice if you are dining with someone celebrating a birthday, as he announces it and recognizes them with song. The view of the river is very pretty. The Dunkel beer selection is a pleasant tasting one, brewed in the Germanic tradition and served in a large clear beer stein. The food as one would expect is typical German fare, no surprises here. Not huge on flavor. But the dessert strudel was made on site fresh, delicate and delicious!  Excellent way to end your meal.
