Even though there's an obvious German beer hall layout and polka band, there was a tangible southern twang (random southern songs, for example) that seemed really out of place at the locale.
Low quality beer.  Tons of fruit flies.  Excessively slow service (with s negative attitude).  Fake German food poorly prepared.  Terrible in every way.

Hofbrauhaus has a great atmosphere. It's very down-to-earth so leave your pretensions at other (more appropriate) joints in Pgh.   But if you're in the mood, it's a great time whether you're standing on the tables belting out Sweet Caroline (for us Pitt fans, or Country Roads for the 'Eers) or doing a shot-ski or just sitting outside on the back area on a pleasant afternoon.  I honestly can't say that the food or the brew here is out of this world. But it ain't half bad either.
The food is good, the beer is better. Definitely a place to try for the ambiance. Recommend going on a tapping night. The place can get pretty packed.

Highly recommended from the locals to go for the experience.  I must say, I wasn't disappointed.  Great looking environment inside and even though I went on a slow Monday night in the middle of December, the place looked like it could be a lot of fun when it's busy.

The bartender was fabulous, I think her name was Alicia...friendly and very informative! She suggested beer and food with no hesitation. When visiting Pittsburgh you must hit this spot at least once it's a great experience.

Moved to Pitt 3 months ago and we've been here five times already. That should say it all. The atmosphere is worth it even if the food wasn't good...but it's delicious. It gets loud!  So maybe not the best for anyone who isn't looking for a bit of a party with their dinner but they have a quiet room or the outside patio. Don't be shy, join in on the fun and maybe take part in the stein holding competition! Get the pretzels, get a dunkel and learn the cheers.

This place is great. The food is fantastic, yum yum yumz.  The beer is also great, I got wasted with my grandma and my parents. Doesn't get much better than that. This is a place that people of any age can have a good time because it's such a drunk shit show.  Only downside is how crowded it tends to get. I had a friend that worked here and managed to get us a seat after like 20 minutes but for the most part people were waiting for at least an hour for a table.  Do it!

Whew. Wow. So, lemme get right to it.  I went to college in Pittsburgh but moved away from the city in 2010. When this place opened, it was THE PLACE to go on a Friday or Saturday night. The music, the big tables, the big beers, the bier cheese pretzels....  Flash forward to last month when I was back in town for a college friend's wedding. My boyfriend and I came here on a Thursday night with two other friends. The weather was nice, and we opted to eat outside. The place was already pretty crowded, and it was only about 5:00 or 6:00pm. I'm not big on German food, and I ate here a couple times in college, but I had never gotten the ham and cheese sandwich on a pretzel bun, which is what I got this time. Wow! What a great sandwich!!!  My meal was really good. The boys ordered a little too much food for themselves and couldn't finish it all, but we all ate a really good dinner. My boyfriend, who had never been to Pgh, LOVED this place.  After dinner, we stayed for quite awhile, and as the night progressed, we felt so much more out of place! We definitely felt like the old people in the place, and we're only in our late 20s!  I guess in the recent past, Hofbrauhaus has gotten into trouble with how they serve their alcohol, so they've gotten REALLY strict about when they'll serve you another beer, and they DON'T do shot skis anymore. We were ID'd when we walked in, by our server, and each time at the bar, too. We didn't get angry about it, though, cause we definitely saw some people that we gave questioning looks--they looked like college freshmen...  Anyway, we had a great time, but we were all much more sober than we EVER were when we came here in college, so that's why I only gave it three stars this time. I guess it'll just never live up to the memories I have here in 2008-2010 :-)

One of my favorite places to go!  Almost impossible to get a good seat in the beer hall though and it is hard to organize big groups.  Also a big plus, they have a changing table for babies in the men's room!  Since I am the beer drinking the hubby takes care of the baby here, way to be progressive Hofbrauhaus!

3 tourists from Arizona came here expecting great German food and we were very disappointed. The food was just blah with no flavor. We did come here at 4pm on a Tuesday so we assumed this place gets high ratings for the location and the overall experience rather than the food. If you're coming for the food then just drive away. $18 for a plate that wasn't good is just too much. But if you want to have good beer and a good time then it seems like a great place.

In all honesty, this place almost got a bad review if the food wasn't so damn good. My cousin took us here. Three of us are over 21 and the fourth is 19. It is a restaurant that serves a lot of really good beer and amazing German food.   Oddly enough and it makes no sense to me, after 9pm they won't let anyone under 21 inside so there was a moment when things felt really stressful. We then learned we could eat in the restaurant on one side we just couldn't eat on the side with the live music and where the bar was.   When we got our table the hostess was incredibly rude. There was a table with three women on one end and 5 empty chairs on the other end of the same table. The dining room we were in was practically empty so I still don't understand why the hostess tried to sit us at the same table with three total strangers? The women at the table gave her the funniest side eyed look I have seen. Then she puts us at the empty table just one row over but it was missing a chair. Instead of taking the chair from the adjacent table, she marched over to the table where the three women were and yanked one of the chairs from the table making a commotion with this awful pissed off look on her face. Slammed it under our table and walked off. We joked with each other that we should have offered to get the chair for her, maybe it wasn't in her job description or maybe she knew and didn't like the three women at the table.   Then comes in cute little blond girl with glasses and a smile from ear to ear. She is our waitress. Super friendly, offered advice when we asked about menu items and overall had a great personality.  OMG! When the food came I was in HEAVEN! The BEST Perogies I have ever had, I do not like cabbage but I LOVED the cabbage here. It was cooked and seasoned so well I could have eaten it all night.   We walked across to the other side after dinner, took a few facebook live videos of the band and everyone standing and dancing on their tables. It was a great experience. Then we went back to the restaurant side to pick up our 19 year old friend. LOL  I recommend going here for sure, if you have minors with you under 21 try and go before 9pm. The strange thing is when I walked across into that area, there were families with children in there but our 19 year old friend wasn't allowed after 9? So if we would have gotten there at 8:30 and stayed until 11:00 he could have gone on that side so it does seem a little strange, but those are the rules.

This place is like some kind of candyland. It's a franchise of the famous Hofbrauhaus in Munich, Germany, and it shows - the waitresses are all dressed in traditional derndl dresses, the beers are served by the liter, the band is led by an accordion and the people stand on their seats and loudly belt out whatever words they know.  Not even the excessive crowd bothered me. Believe me, it was packed in this place. But this is one of those places where the experience is made better by the huge, rambunctious group of drinking buddies all around you. I will go back every time I visit this town.

This is a great place if you are an undergraduate student looking for huge mugs of beer, along with someone's idea of acceptable German food. As a huge fan of German food and culture, I felt like this place was a Disney-fied version of the country I love. Not super authentic, and nothing was particularly tasty or notable. The crowds are HUGE and there's nothing truly notable or amazing about the place to make it worth elbowing your way through hundreds of drunken undergrads. I would not return anytime soon.

Stopped in here for a beer and snack after a bike ride on the first nice spring day this year. Was hoping they would have the marzen on tap since it was March. No marzen on tap, they were still serving the February beer at the end if march, my half liter had a good inch plus of head, so did every other beer I watched the bartender pour. This is a beerhouse, you'd think they would know how to pour a beer. On top if that the beer wasn't even cold, just slightly lower than room temp. The pretzels I got were about on par with those frozen soft pretzels you can buy at the grocery store. I paid $10 for the pretzels and $5 for the half liter. Penn brewery is much better than this place, if you want a good German beer house experience go there. This place is more of a German themed Applebee's, if that.

When this place first opened, I thought it was heaven on earth. But after my first ten visits the novelty has worn off. The food is ok, and the service is hit or miss. If you have friends in town that have never been, it's definitely worth taking them to the hofbrauhaus.
Love Hofbrauhaus, every time we come to Pittsburgh we try to stop. Fun atmosphere and great food. The Hot Brown and Potato Pancakes are the tops!

I had a great time drinking my massive beers and eating some kielbasa.  The food was pretty good, but a bit pricey for what I got.  I saw some shot-skis going down and really enjoyed the live polka.    There is also outside seating.   I would definitely recommend this place for a group or a party.

This place was awesome.  Service was quick and from the friendliest server.  We loved the beer and the giant pretzel with three different sauces satisfied every one at our table. ( we actually order a second one  it was so good) Schnitzel and sauerbraten were tender and tasty  I loved the fried cabbage and save room for the dessert.  He music was loud be we were having so much fun we hardly noticed.

This review is for the bar only. This is what I want heaven to be like, flowing dunkel, drunk friendly people, the best cover band in the land, and bier cheese that I would literally kill for.  If you would rather drink, dance, sing and have a good time over grinding randomly COME HERE! If you just wanna grind and hook up don't come here you won't have fun. I have been to A LOT of bars and this is my overall favorite, I go at least once a month hopefully more.

Hofbrauhaus is a whole lot of fun.  Servers in costume, a beer hall, and gigantic beers.  If you are in the mood for a non-quiet meal, you should definitely sit in the beer hall.  They have live entertainment (on most days I think) in a wide open seating area.  If you want something a little more peaceful, the patio is nice and has a decent view over the river.  Pretty much everything on the menu is either meaty or deep fried so this is not the place for trying to eat something light, but as long as you are not, everything is delicious.  If you have people to share with and plenty of appetite, the sampler plates are a good way to try a variety of foods - they have them for appetizers, wursts, and entrees.  The beer is great too, and comes in 1 liter steins (they also have 1/2 liters, if you don't want that much).  With tasty German food, beer, and a unique atmosphere, Hofbrauhaus is definitely worth a visit.

Undoubtedly the best lager I have had in years.  The assorted appetizers are freshly made and delicious.  The interior definitely resembles a German beer hall (namely the original Hofbrauhas in Munich), although the house band could use more lessons.  Eins, zwei, g'suffa !

Hofbrauhaus is just so much fun!  Absolutely LOVE the drinking atmosphere. The grand tables, the ginormous "dining hall" (or drinking hall?), the lovely covered terrace - it's all great!  I came here for dinner last night and enjoyed a couple brews (I think I had the one for October? They have a different beer every month! AMAZING). I started with the pretzels and biercheese and ordered the spatzle with chicken and mushrooms. The biercheese was definitely the highlight of the meal - fresh homemade pretzels and a light (but still rich) cheddar beer dip. I literally have a craving for these at least once a week!  The spatzle was pretty good, but nothing exciting. For those of you like me who have never really eaten German food before, spatzle is a dense, egg noodle that vaguely resembles gnocchi. The Heidelberger Rahm Spatzle (what I got) consisted of chicken breast, marsala cream sauce, caramelized onions, and mushrooms. My boyfriend got the Kasespatzle (like a mac 'n' cheese) and that was super rich, but very tasty. I'd recommend splitting that one.  Service and atmosphere were great, food wasn't bad. I'd definitely come here again for a round or two and some biercheese!

A very nice, authentic-ish place.  We had the Wurstplatte, Leberkase, and the Hefe Weizen beer and they were all good. The Kartoffelsalat is very good!  The staff is pretty friendly and the atmosphere feels very warm.  Definitely recommended for those seeking a European touch to their days and seeking to get a beer with some friends.
Big beer steins.  Delicious beer.  Sing-a-long drinking bands.  What more could you ask for?
I think if you're already drunk and are independently wealthy, Hofbrauhaus is fun.   The food quality is actually better than I anticipated.

Their beer was decent but overall I feel like there are better breweries and beer destinations in the city. I do enjoy stopping in occasionally for the atmosphere. The German music, great hall setup, shot-skis and lederhosen can make for a rowdy crowd at times.

Spent the last night of a cross-country roadtrip at Hofbrauhaus, much to the recommendation of a friend we made hundreds of miles away. Safe to say the beer garden left a lasting impression.   Props the barkeep for the chill and low-key conversation. With pints the size of our heads, there is a good chance that I flubbed a few words or two, and I'd do it all again in a heartbeat

This place is a curious mix of really good and so-so...  The good... - I am looking forward to summer, because their outdoor space is fantastic.  Right on the river with a great view and some fun activities.   - If you are looking for a fun, rowdy vibe in a place that isn't dirty and completely nuts, this is the place.  It's a good drinking atmosphere.    The so so... - The food.   My companion grew up in Germany and wasn't impressed with any of it.   As an American, I thought half of what we ordered was really good.  Half was really not.   The winners were the pretzels with bier cheese, the potato pancakes, and the cob salad.   The pork shank with cracklins, the pierogies, sauerkraut, and cabbage were all not so great.    - The portions.   They must be trying to compete with their ridiculously over-portioned neighbor, the Cheesecake Factory, because every dish we ordered was humongous.  Not a lot of healthy options to begin with and the portions are over the top.   I recommend sharing for sure.    - The music.  They had an accordion player in all of the traditional garb.  He stopped at prescribed intervals to sing some German song and make a toast.  It was cute the first time, but quickly became repetitive.   Would probably have been fine if we were there for drinking and not dinner, but as it was, we were sort of over it.    A couple of other things to know.    - Valet service is $8 and the area where I had to pull it was pretty far from the front door.  When leaving, I had to walk out in the rain to get to the valet stand.  He told me I could wait inside and he'd come get me, but that was only after I asked.  Several people were standing out in the rain waiting for their cars. - If you are there to eat, request a table closer to the bar (and farther from the music).  We had to shout to be heard over the accordion.
A fun place on Fridays and Saturdays when they have the band playing and everyone is dancing on the tables.

In my opinion- it's best time to go to the Hofbrauhaus is on an off time of the day. I met up with some friends from other of town for Sunday lunch at 12:45 pm and we got seated right away. We didn't sit on the main dining room, but sat in the quieter dining room area where it was quieter and we could catch up. Perfect for families of all ages.   For an appetizer, we order the 4 pretzels with beer cheese. They were delicious and the perfect amount to share.    For my main course - I ordered the spaetzle with shredded chicken and mushrooms and a side of potato pancakes. I had never tried this before - but now it will be my go-to.    Our waitress was very knowledgeable about the menu - she suggested what beers for me to try.    For dessert- we split the cinnamon pretzel with cream cheese icing. I loved it and would definitely get it again.   Overall, I enjoyed my experience at the Hofbrauhaus and will be back again soon.

Oh farfegnugen!  Alright - I have no idea what that means but it was a good night at the ole Hofbrau.  I ended up taking my engineers who were craving some German Food.    We put on our best yard gnome attire (atleast that is what it reminds me when I see shorts and suspenders) and took the drive down to Hofbrau.  We were quickly seated.    There was a gentleman who was quite good playing the keyboard and interacting with the crowd.   Many people were doing what appeared to be Ski Shots (shots done with a group that were on a ski).    Please note - if you are the shortest person in your group - you will tend to get wet.    I don't know why but what you think will be a casual shot will end up being a silly experience out of Nickelodeon.  The restaurant was not filled to capacity by no means but we had to wait 15 minutes before we were asked for our first beers.   In the waitress defense, she had 2 large tables.   After we received our first beer and put in our appetizer order we did not care.  Appetizer - I order the team the works - potato cakes, fried pickles, sauerkraut balls, and pretzels.   It was good but nothing to write home about.  Dinner - Bavarian Jägerschnitzel  a pan seared Pork Cutlet topped with a Burgundy Wine Mushroom and Bacon Sauce with Bacon Slices served with Cranberry Sauce, German Potato Salad and Chef 's Vegetable Selection.  My dinner was very good.   The pork was cooked perfectly, the sauce was tasty, and bacon will always be the perfect meat candy to any meal.  The Beer - I had the Oktoberfest beer (limited time) and Lager.  The beer at Hofbrau is always pretty good.  If you are in a group - this is the place to go.  I will be back but there are many local places I would rather go to in comparison - thus the three stars.   There is nothing wrong with the place - I am sure I will be back.

This is one of my favorite places, especially for the outdoor seating in the summer. If you're not in your twenties or like to party, I'd avoid this place on the weekends.   The soft pretzels and wheat beer are the best around.

love it here! you must come atleast once! for people of all ages and they do great jobs for birthdays! food is good and beer is great! they have a nice view of the river with outdoor seating, come early if you dont have a reservation-- they are always packed!

Where can I start... This place is awesome! I went on a Friday night! The girls wear a beautiful German uniform. It's a safe environment, there are security at every door so picking a fight in such a fun place will be difficult. The food was served hot and beautifully displayed. Our drinks served cold in ice cold mugs. Our server Nicole was sweet, friendly and was honest when telling us she didn't know how something tasted. This place is beautifully put together. They had live band that night and I got to dance on the benches and some others danced on the tables. The environment is just amazing! 5 stars to this place because of the place is clean, quick to serve us, friendly, food was unique, drinks where served chilled, and the music was top notch. A place to go with family, friends or both at the Same time!

Are you kidding me? THIS PLACE IS AWESOME. I thought I was dreaming, but when I woke up in a bier cheese stained shirt, sore legs from dancing on tables, and had the smell of beer on my breath - I knew that I had in fact experienced heaven.   Unfortunately though, I awoke still not having a clue as to who the f*** Alice is. And that's ok with me because I will be back a million times more to chant her name anyway.
Excellent food and beer. Atmosphere is loud but not overpowering. Wait staff very good, friendly, and helpful.  Our server Heather did an excellent job.

Everything about  hof brau was fantastic.   Atmosphere, great outside seating.   Even inside is a cool experience - was their during the World Cup and it was a blast. Brat, sauerkraut, potato pancakes - everything we ordered was bring home good.  Beers were cold and fresh out of the barrel.   Can't wait to go back.

This place is awesome! So much fun. I went for the first time on my birthday recently and had a blast! It's like a huge party/smorgasbord. Neato German looking guy singing up front and calling out the shot-ski's!!! Shot-skis are so fun! (kinda expensive but well worth it). This is a great place to have tons of fun with a whole room of friends and people you will meet for the first time! Loads of fun, Great beer and food!!
My Wife and I had the beer sampler and the App Plater and everything was great. Our server Cydne was helpful and very friendly.

This restaurant gets a resounding 'meh' from me.  I really enjoy coming here--when it's convenient and usually in the summer because I like the outdoor biergarten.  Their bier is SCHEISS.  FURCHTBAR.  It's going to impress you if you've never had actual German beer.  I have.  It just doesn't taste right.  The best brew of the bunch is the Witbier.  Try ordering the Radler beeer, which is the wheat beer mixed with lemonade.  It's very refreshing.  If you enjoy sodium, you will LOVE the food.  Everything here is way too salty.  I think it's so they sell more beer?  Or maybe it's just bc I've quit smoking, now I think everything is salty.  I will fight you over the beer cheese pretzel.  It's pretty damn good.  Also, the Hot Brown looks a little iffy on the menu but my friend ordered it and she said it was fantastic.  .  Be prepared to losen your dirndl and let your Lederhosen out bc the portions are HUGE.  The caloric value of the food would probably be horrifying.  You can just drink your way through your diet guilt.  The service is usually fantastic and the food does come out quickly  Don't come to the Hofbrauhaus if you've had a bad day at work and need to vent to a friend--I made thie mistake of doing this and this is how I learned that the most annoying sound in the world when you're stressed out is that of an old man attempting to yodel.  Not even a very large witbier could save me.

This place is very popular especially among the younger crowd. But for me going here is like going to Disney world. Not because it's awesome but because when you go you remember why you haven't visited for 10 years. The main hall is EXTREMELY LOUD !  There is usually a live band playing polkas and people are seated at long rows of tables with people screaming to talk over each other and the music.   The food is okay. When we visited we arrived in time for happy hour (5-7pm) and saw on the website that to take advantage of happy hour pricing you had to go to the bar area. We asked the hostess if we could sit outside at a table and still participate and she said "anywhere" in the restaurant. But when we sat down at a table they said we were misinformed and would have to go to the bar if we wanted happy hour.   Outside there is a bar, and we had to belly up to get a limited selection of happy hour beers and pay a separate tab.   The appetizers were half price there.   The service was slow too. There was only one server (who was brand new) to cover too many tables.   Long story short, it will probably be another 10 years before I return and recall why I didn't go sooner.   IMO if you want good German food there are much better choices in da burgh.   Ps - there is no free parking. Either you have to valet for $8 + tip or find street parking or garage parking a block away and walk.

First off - I love their beer. It's always delicious, and it's definitely a fun atmosphere.  However, I think their food is a bit of a disappointment. I'm a vegetarian, and the things I've tried have all been mediocre at best.  Overall a fun atmosphere - but there are so many other cool places in the South Side, that I think this just doesn't live up to the hype.

I've only been to Hofbrauhaus few times over the years and so far my experience has been good. Good Food .. Great Beer and attentive staff depending on what time of the day you get there.  The place it self is humongous and well placed along the river board walk. The bier garden is great during summer.  I will definitely go back again for the atmosphere and the beer but not so much for the food.

This is definitely NOT up my ally.  First, I recommend going at least tipsy.  The beers are pretty good for being 'home made' (for lack of a better word) and very reasonably priced.  For me, I just want delicious beers.  They don't have to be home-made.  I rather a beer not home-made that tastes amazing than one that is OK that was home-made.  It's a large place, so it's pretty spacious considering how many people filter in. The live bands are OK, but it gets very kum bah yah-ish.    This is a place for you if you like live bands and lots of noise and people dancing on their seats. When it comes to night life, I am strictly for electronic dance music, so my review may not be 100% fair,  but it is true that I personally have experienced much better.  FYI, they check purses before you leave so don't do anything stupid.

I have wanted to come to the Hofbrauhaus since my 21st birthday but just made it here a few weeks ago.  To be honest, I don't get why people love it so much.  The food is very Americanized German, and the atmosphere is so strange.  I ordered the Bauren Schnitzel ($16.95), which was a Pork cutlet with Ham and American Cheese.  Think a cheap version of chicken cordon bleu.  It was the waxy American cheese.  This was the kind of thing I would expect to get from a dive bar or cheap diner.  I also had a dark beer that, while dark in color, was not dark in flavor.  It was fine just not what I expected.  My dad was super unimpressed with his Weisswurst.  So food was a bust, beer was ok.  I think the low point came when at 6:00 pm on a weeknight people were plastered.  The waitresses were serving multiple drinks to people simultaneously, which is illegal.  Some creepy old man who was there with his TEN children was double-fisting liters of beer.  And he and his children spent the evening running through the tables.  The Von Trapp family with a drinking problem?  Guess that's what I get for eating fake German food.  If you just want to drink, go to the Beer Garden at a time children are not allowed.  Otherwise, skip the Hofbrauhaus.
The food here was really good. The family enjoyed themselves and the ambience made you feel like you were in Bavaria.
A place with atmosphere, public and menu. Beer very close to authentic standards. Good schnitzels and soups. Occasional live music (accordion of course).

The beer and appetizers are the only reason to go here. The entrees are decent but not worth the price- a novelty place but lacking in actually good meals. The pork was good but not outstanding. We only go here when visitors come to the city because they insist on going. There are dozens of better places in the area for the same money.
The beer and the atmosphere are the absolute best. Service is fantastic and management very attentive. Probably my favorite place to visit when bike riding in Pittsburgh.

This has become the goto place with the Fam.  Us parents get to enjoy the bier (this time we went large and got the liter size) and our nearly adult child drives us home, keeping us and everyone around us safe.  It's nice because the the music is entertaining whether you are drinking or not, the place looks festive whether you're drinking or not, you can sit outside or inside, in short - a great place for the Fam!  There are a couple parking garages nearby, as well as metered on-street parking (which is free after 6pm.) This is Southside, so there are a lot of other interesting things within walking distance.

I went to this restaurant for a business/social event. Our server was very friendly. The drinks were great. The dinner was excellent and received a large portion. The traditional German band was a lot of fun. Everything was clean and decor provided a German feel.

We met some friends for dinner here as we both passed through town. We really enjoyed the uniqueness of the menu (for us). We were seated at a nice big wooden table on the upstairs patio (which was good, because it looked like a college Oktoberfest party going on in the main restaurant area). We started off with "the works" sampler and, despite small portions, everything tasted great (especially the fried pickles, sauerkraut balls, beer cheese. For dinner I had Wurstplatte sampler which was all good. My son had the Bavarian Jagerschnitzel which was very good. My daughter had the Kasespatzel which she said was good. Mom had the cordon blue Schnitzel which she enjoyed. Our dining guest also enjoyed their meals. I also enjoyed a couple half pints of the Hefe Weizen beer. That was good too. So, we give it a five-star rating overall.

We ordered our food and it literally took over an hour for our food to be delivered.  The waitress came over to our table and mentioned that she that the kitchen was behind in the orders because the place was so big and they staff it with 18 year olds.  Well to me that's and excuse and not a solution.  The waitress could have offered a solution by giving us some type of discount or coupons like the coupe that was seated in the booth next to us.
Great service, great beer, great food.  I had the bratwurst with potato pancake and sauerkraut - all were great.

I just love the atmosphere here!! It's very unique and engaging. I had came here a couple of times for food and just to grab drinks. In terms of the food, it was ok. It wasn't anything amazing but it was good. However,  I really enjoy the variety of beer that they offer. In terms of the environment,  the waitresses are dressed in German uniforms and they have a live band playing. Although it is quite loud in here, it makes it fun to stand up on the tables and sing along with everyone else. I would definitely recommend this place for the experience! Also, it's usually quite crowded on weekends.

Eery friendly and loved the atmosphere.   Food was okay, as was my clam chowder, but nothing was out of the ordinary. They seemed really busy even when the place wasn't packed (perhaps understaffed?) and as other reviewers have mentioned, is it REALLY noisy. As in.. not hearing each other talk even sitting at the bar, which could be the downside to the visually pleasing hall. It is a chain, but they only have couple of locations in the US.

So even before moving back to Pittsburgh in October of 2010, I had the opportunity to experience the Hofbrauhaus... and I did not like it then.  So since I moved within a stones throw of the place, I have decided to give it many a chances to wow me in some regard to make me like it and want to come back (I mean, for the sake of convenience, it would be an ideal place to like more than we do).  After numerous attempts at at least liking it enough to come back once a month, I cannot even do that.    The main hall is obnoxious.... I guess I am getting old as I cannot stand how loud it is and it always baffles me how many smaller children and babies are there with their families... especially since I have seen people get rowdy at times.    The only way I will be back is outside in the warmer weather... I like to avoid the aforementioned hoopla.    The food (minus some of the apps) leaves little to be desired in my opinion.  With so many other better dining options in town, this is not somewhere I will go for a full meal.    Service is hit or miss... I often seemed to have more luck at the bar than dealing with a server.    The beer is good... and the prices are good as well for the quantities.... so I guess that should help improve the rating to at least three stars (that coupled with the beer garden).

This place is awesome if you're looking for good German food. The beer is very good as well. Some people complain about the parking and that you may have to walk a whole block to eat here. Well it is a city and that's unfortunately how it is. Some other reviews talk about how the bands are loud and it's not some quaint restaurant. Well this is supposed to mimic a sort of beer "tent" at Oktoberfest, not be the French Landry.  Bottom line is if you want good German food and beer, this is the place. The sauerbraten and schnitzels are great. The service is very good and so is the atmosphere. For anyone looking at this review, ignore the idiots that gave a low rating. They are most likely snobs. I've eaten here with people that had lived in Germany for a long time and even they told me it was very good. I will continue to try different items here.  So there ya go

This was a second visit to the Hofbrauhaus, and was one place we knew we would get seated without a long wait on a Friday night in Pittsburgh.  The atmosphere inside is a beer hall, with all the accompanying noise and liveliness, but we chose the terrace because it was a beautiful summer evening, and we would have a view of the river.  The food is hearty, ample and amazing.  For starters four of us split "The Works" sampler, which I highly recommend:  soft pretzels with beer cheese, potato pancakes with applesauce, fried pickles with ranch dressing, and sauerkraut balls with honey mustard.  Whoops, just had to wipe the drool off my keyboard.  Wursts, schnitzels, and meats oh my.  The fare is pretty authentic German with a few items thrown in for the hipster or pickier eaters in your group.  Not surprisingly there is a great beer selection.  A fun place to go.

Nice and cheerful atmosphere. I had the Hefe Weizen and couldn't stop drinking it. Pretzels and beer cheese are a must. We were scraping the beer cheese container trying to get the last drop. I wasn't a fan of the german potato salad (my sister recommended it because she loves it). It might be because it's definitely nothing like traditional American potato salad so if that's what you're in the mood for, this definitely is not similar. The sauerkraut is the BEST sauerkraut I've eaten. I would most definitely eat a bowl of it alone.
Festive!  Loved the app tray! Pretzels were good, kraut and ham balls were excellent! Fried pickles...yum!  Even the craft beer was good (I'm not usually a fan).

I have been here multiple times. They have multiple seating options - inside, balcony, and the beer garden. For your first visit, I would recommend sitting inside. This place offers a unique experience of dancing on your seats while the music plays. This is super fun, but do not step on the table, since that will lead to ousting. The beer garden is also fantastic, but it's open only during the warm months. The balcony is just like any other outdoor seating, but you get a really nice view of the river.  All their beers are amazing. The original, the hefe weizen, the dunkel, and the red beer. They also have a seasonal option. The red beer is probably my favorite. The last time I was there, I had 2 liters of that!   I'm not a big fan of their food, but a lot of my friends swear by it. This place is definitely a must go.

Am I the only one that doesn't like this place?  I really just can't get into the vibe of this place.  The atmosphere is terrible, the food is on par with applebees or TGIFridays, and the drinks are irresponsibly large.  Seriously though, why are your beers that big?  It's irresponsible to expect patrons to pace themselves when your beers are the size of a growler.  I know you've had a lot of problems with the PLCB, and yet you continue to over-serve patrons, and then let them stand on crowded solid wood tables before sending them out into the world in an area where they'll almost certainly have to drive out of.   for reference:  http://www.post-gazette.com/local/city/2013/05/07/Owners-of-South-Side-s-Hofbrauhaus-settle-in-girl-s-death-for-15-6-million/stories/201305070253  http://www.post-gazette.com/local/city/2015/12/24/Couple-sue-Hofbrauhaus-over-intoxicated-customer/stories/201512240152
This restaurant is very nice. The staff was very friendly and service was great. The food is delicious and there is a great selection of beer. Definitely loved the music and how everyone was dressed.

Went here on a Tuesday night after Germany beat Brazil in a 2014 World Cup match.  The night was very comfortable so we sat outside along the river.  We had the Hofbrau Hefe Weizen beer, the Bavarian Jagerschnitzel and a Dunkel Bourbon Chicken Sandwich.  All were excellent.  The service was efficient and attentive.  My son who is attending school in Pittsburgh said he was definitely coming back with his friends.  The price seemed very reasonable less than $90 for three.

After walking 2 miles on the Three Rivers Heritage trail, my bf suggested to have a beer and dinner at Hofbrauhaus.. I almost tried to talk him out of it because who wants to eat carbs and beer after going on a 2 mile hike??   The reason for this update is to let you know Hofbrauhaus has amazing salads! I was stuck between the Munich Market Salad and Cobb Salad. I decided on the Munich. It had chopped romaine lettuce, strawberries, mandarin oranges, pineapple chucks, dried cranberries, glazed pecans onion and feta cheese. I added grilled chicken for an up-charge (you can also add salmon). The dressing on the salad was raspberry poppy seed.   That salad was ^&%$#@*  amazing! So fresh, so filling and tasty. It went perfect with the light beer option (Hefe Weizen.. my fav!!)   They also offered a Pittsburgh Salad as well as a few other options.  ****You can buy 6 packs to-go. Their beer is also sold at D's 6 packs & dogs

Ahhhh I love this place!! Definitely a must if you're visiting Pittsburgh or a resident! The beer serving are huge!!! I was having a pretty good time after the first huge glass! And those soft pretzels are to die for!   We sat on the patio, such a beautiful view out there! Love the atmosphere and how freaking big the place is! Definitely perfect for big groups of people! Great if you actually want to go out and have conversation with people.   I also saw a lot of families in there so it looks like it can be enjoyable for almost everyone (maybe not young children)! Highly recommend!

I visited this restaurant with two friends around Christmastime during the daytime on a weekend. The restaurant was not busy at all, and we had our choice of table. If you like German food, you probably will enjoy this restaurant. German food is just not my favorite. I had difficulty with finishing all of my sausages. Maybe next time I will more wisely order my food. I am not a beer drinker so did not try their beer. (Yes, why did "I" go to "this" restaurant?!) My friend said that he enjoyed his food and beer. Prices were moderate. Our waiter was nice and served us well.

I've been here a couple of times with my friends and it's never disappointed me. Several of my German friends have mentioned that the food is not as authentic as it should be. But hey, it's like Americanized Chinese food - nobody would say it's authentic but it can still taste great. I absolutely loved the soft pretzels they have. The schnitzel was on point too. I was especially happy with the large serving size.

As a German, I can say that this place is a little kitchy piece of Heaven for me. Although Hofbrauhaus is a very touristy place in Germany, that doesn't make it any less fun. Hofbrauhaus has delicious Bavarian staples. This place is downright fun! I love going here with my friends to have the same beer I drink at Oktoberfest in Germany!

We had a wonderful time at Hofbrauhaus when visiting some friend's to celebrate some birthdays. We really wanted to go there because we are planning to go to Oktoberfest this year, and what a better place to prepare than the Hofbrauhaus, right? It was so much fun!  We weren't able to get a table in the main room at first so we went to the side room where we got some appetizers, and a few people got meals. I enjoyed looking over the menu at some of the traditional German dishes. If you are not a fan of German food, then don't expect to like their food. I rather enjoyed the things I tried - including the weiner schnitzel, the kraut balls, and the pretzels.   The beer was really good too and pretty cheap. I tried the Premium Lager, the Hefe Weizen, and the Dunkel. I liked the Premium the best, but the others were good too. You got a ton of beer for the cost, and I was even able to buy the stein for an extra $10 to add to my beer boots and steins collection.   We also enjoyed doing some shot skis, where we all lined up and downed a shot together. One of my friends was the short one on her ski and got a shot in her eye - so just make sure the taller folks bend down a bit! It was pretty funny though.   Once the main room opened up a bit, we headed over there to dance on the tables and cheers each other with our steins. It was a really fun night, and I would definitely recommend a trip there if you are into Oktoberfest-type or binge-drinking activities. Fun times indeed!!

A friend and I were enjoying our meals.  I am in a bad habit of chewing my straw whenever I am talking to somebody.  I had a regular Coke and since my friend is a diabetic he had a Diet Coke.  The waitress asked us if we wanted a refill and we both said yes.  Whenever the waitress return she gave me the Diet Coke and my friend the Coke.  I would have never known this is my straw wasn't chewed up.  I told her that hey you accidentally gave us the wrong drinks.  If my friend would have drank my drink he could have gone into a severe diabetic shock or got very ill.  I know this can happen at any restaurant but I'm hoping that somebody can start the ball rolling that everybody would get a different color strong or something to know what your guess what.
Very nice selection of food for both adults and kids.   A wide variety of beer to choose from too.   Also, tons of places to sit and is very spacious.

Great place to go with a big group for something different than just heading out to the bars. I've been to the original one in Munich, and its American incarnation was pretty much along the same lines--beer, table-dancing (well, bench-dancing) to cheesy songs that everyone knows the words to, and lots of fun.  As far as beer goes, I wasn't big on their Weizen (wheat beer) and I'm not a fan of lagers in general. Love their Dunkel though, so I always order that. Most of my friends always get the light beer...no comment. Food here isn't very good. Zucchini planks are the only thing I like (huge portion, good for snacking with a group). All the meat dishes are extremely dry and heavy on the salt. Personally, I wouldn't recommend this as a dinner/drinking combo. Eat elsewhere, then come here to drink.  Another negative, the place gets way too crowded. If you come before 10pm, there will be an obscene wait for a table (and it's not fun if you don't get a table). Sometimes table reservations will be booked for the night as early as 7pm. Come late, and you can usually find some friendly strangers to jump in with. It's a little bit of a hassle to come here on a regular basis, but for birthdays or other special occassions, it's a great spot.

I would call Hofbrauhaus the Applebee's of Beer Halls, but that's only because it's a chain. The food is actually quite good and the beer - though not so good as to make me tear up - is good. This place gets PACKED, though, so I suggest either getting there early or else heading down to the outside picnic tables. The scene there is much more relaxed and the view is great.  BEER SELECTION: Lagers all, with the occasional altbier. Solid, but not overly impressive. FOOD SELECTION: Traditional german stuff with an emphasis on sausages. Good and well priced. SERVICE: It gets noisey in the hall, what with the singing, yelling, cheering, and dancing, so you'll have to forgive the waitstaff if they always seem to be in a rush.  Shotskis are to be shared with four people. Jager and Honey Jager shots are poured into shot glasses glued to a ski, then drank at one time by the participants. Have fun!

Allergy friendly.... Dairy, shellfish, all nuts.  I always forget to take before pics.  Sorry.  Had the Hungarian goulash and beef brat!  My son he needed a straw to get every last bite of goulash and if hot dogs tasted like the bratwurst, he would eat them.... Just as well, no hotdogs for him.  BTW they subbed it no problem for kids hot dog meal.  Steamed broccoli on the side I stead of fries.  Interesting, fun place.  9 of us, big group.  Sat in quiet room.

I enjoyed our experience at Hofbrauhaus.  We went on a Sunday afternoon around 3:30 so the cavernous restaurant seemed very empty.  We were quickly greeted and our request for a table inside but with a view of the river was accommodated with a smile.    We started with the "Works" sampler.  Because it was slow in the restaurant, the food came out much more quickly than we had expected it to.  It was tasty and quite a bit of food.  However, it cost more than either of our entrees did.  The pretzels were the standard soft pretzel.  The bier cheese, however, was fantastic!  I wish they would have given us more than just the small cup worth.  The plate also included fried pickels (which were pretty standard as well).  What stood out wer ethe sauerkraut balls (served with honey mustard).  They were unique, crisp and tasty.  The combo was rounded out with potato pancakes served with applesauce.  While I enjoyed the potato pancakes, I expected better from a German restaurant.  Main entrees were the Jagerscnitzel and Kasespatzle.  The Jagerschnitzel is pork with a wine mushroom/bacon sauce.  The pork was tender and the breading crisp and tasty.  It came with a delectable German potato salad and a fried cabbage that I can't say much more about other than "meh."  The Kasespatzle was, as expected, very heavy (the dish contains swiss cheese, onions nad heavy cream sauce).  It was too much for my taste, but my fiance loved it.    While we were dining, a leiderhosen clad accordian player kept the small crowd entertained with traditional German favorites with the Chicken Dance thrown in for good measure.    Overall, we had an enjoyable and tasty experience.  Hofbrauhaus certainly won't be a regular stop, but we will visit again.

It's a fun night out at the HB in Pittsburgh's South Side. For a big beer hall I'm always amazed at how great the food is. It never disappoints! The schnitzel is best in the city, and the sausages are authentic German. The beer selection is great as expected. Best we like the atmosphere of the space - even on a slower night the place is welcoming and cheerful!

This place is quite the unique experience. Only been here a couple times, and while I don't personally enjoy this type of environment too much, it can be good fun once in a while (or even just for people watching). There's seating both indoors and outdoors-sih (the latter like a patio but not really outside in the cold air), and you can choose to be as close to or as far away from the revelry as you want. Come later at night and people will be drinking and singing, and oftentimes dancing on the benches.   As for the beers and the food, they are quite passable. My personal favorite is the hefeweizen, but they also offer several other standard varieties. There is a lot of German fare food, from wurst to pretzels to salads to various entrees. While I don't personally think they are amazing, they all do go very well with the beer.

Not a beer person, but if you are, make a stop here and I'm almost guaranteed that you'll like it. When I came here with my bf, I felt like we entered a German village. The performances were great, the place was HUGE, and the crowd was just one big happy family.

Joe Malloy! I love that guy. This is such a great place.  About as good as the Las Vegas place.  The food is tremendous, both in flavor and quantity.  The pretzels are wonderful, with beer cheese. Schnitzel was fantastic.  I even loved the sauerkraut balls. This place has more beers than Vegas which is cool.  They have a different beer every month.  Wish I lived in the area.

If you order a liter you can get a brand new liter glass for only $10!  Super fun place! Bier cheese and soft pretzels are as good as it gets!  Definitely good German food.  Bartenders are awesome and super friendly. This place gets off the chain nuts on the weekend at night!

The food here is great! I got the "Hofbräuhaus Würstlplatte" with German potato salad and a potato pancake. I have no issues with the food all! Very well prepared and delicious!   I got their February seasonal beer which was the "adulerator". Being that it was like 8% alcohol you are unable to get it in a big liter mug... So i had 4 of the half liters.  It was delicious and boy did i end up feeling it!   My only issue is not being able to give reservations. We had a group of 16, and it would have been great to make them.  That being said, our est wait time of 2 hrs was right on, so no complaint there.   Our service was great! She was very attentive and a fun person! I dont think i could handle that many people at one time! She had no problem splitting up our bill (which was probably a pain) and even reminded us all that gratuity was included for each!  Very considerate!  We ended up having to sit in the dining area and not the bar area so it was much tamer experience that we wanted, but it was still fun!  Good food, good beer equals a great time!

Just stopped here for drinks by the river.  They offer a German-style beer garden, but it was nice to know that there was a selection of affordable non-beer options.  The ambience was pleasant.  The service was decent.  I definitely will have to revisit for food one of these days.  Looks like it could be a fun time.
Very fun if you are looking to pay attention to the band and not your group mates!  Dance on your seat if you have the gumption!

This was always one of our favorite places to go in Pittsburgh until last night. When we arrived around 6:30 they said it would be an hour wait. That wasn't a problem as our family was looking forward to this visit for a few months. We were seated at 7:30 and place our order rather quickly. Waitress said kitchen is running a little behind tonight at the time of our order but didn't really say what a little was. Turns out a little means over an hour and fifteen minutes until your food will get to your table. I hope they address the issues with the kitchen at sometime because it really used to be a fun place to go. Would not recommend to anyone until they fix the service.

Not terrible, but still not good.   Hofbrauhaus is a cool place to visit if you enjoy standing on tables and singing... great for friends, not so much for grandma. The staff's  "German" outfits and the giant mugs of beer are pretty much the highlights. The restaurant has mediocre live music that only is bearable after a few of the aforementioned beers.   While fun if you're with the right group, don't come here for the food. It's overpriced, inauthentic, and overall pretty bland. After going a few times, I've certainly exceeded my quota. Unless some naive friend decides to have a birthday party here, I will not be returning.

Situated on a lovely plot of land bordering the river walk in the heart of Pittsburgh, this restaurant has a great feel especially in the summer. There is a ton of outdoor seating if you're in the mood. The indoor seating is also welcoming and contains beautiful murals that are reminiscent of German life. The food is delicious, traditional German food and the staff is very friendly. We visited this restaurant on vacation and our server was very open and willing to give us recommendations of good spots to visit in Pittsburgh. I hope I can visit here again on my next visit to the burgh!

Another e-mail not answered about parking validation options to offset the cost of valet parking.   So, you know what? I'm tired of paying for parking. The food isn't much (except for the potato soup, and I enjoy many beers and wines found elsewhere.   Probably will never visit Hofbrauhaus again.   Valet costs plus tip equals two craft beers somewhere else with free parking.   Good bye Hofbrauhaus. I enjoyed you in Munich in the '60's, can live without  you now.

I have a like/dislike relationship with this place. It is great if you are freshly 21 and/or are in college or are in party mode. The food is nothing special, the drinks are huge, and it is just one big singing/drinking party. The live entertainment they had was drinking beer whilst they were singing and...it got interesting.

I went to Hofbrauhaus Pittsburgh while visiting some friends on 6/6/15. I had an idea of what the experience would be like having been to the 1 in Munich Germany many years ago.   I am going to start with what I didn't like and then explain why I am giving it 4 stars. The restaurant is loud and I found myself screaming at my friends a couple of times so they could hear me. I am not sure if the spotty service was because our waitress was over taxed with tables or she gave us our space so we could continue drinking and eating. Either way, I would have liked her to check on us a couple of times more than she did. I would have liked 2nd drink but by the time she came around my friends wanted the check. The gift shop was also very limited with their sizes for tee shirts. I would have bought more souvenirs than I did if more was available.   However with all that being said it is a really fun atmosphere at Hofbrauhaus Pittsburgh. The band although they made the restaurant loud, I liked how they encouraged people to stand up on the stools and toast. I remember when I went to Germany part of the fun of beer gardens is making "friends" with strangers by toasting each other. The cover songs the band played also were very good; and, I thought overall the quality of the music was truly professional.   The portions of food like the beer are HUGE and really good. My pretzel and salad were both so delicious I forced myself to continue eating.   In a nutshell not a great place to go if you'd like to sit down and have a conversation with someone but a really fun atmosphere and a truly unique experience if you're in the area.

No disrespect to those who have come here and had a great time -- I am sure it's possible.  I mean who doesn't love 2490589348 people standing on top of tables smashing their beer mugs (that must weigh ten pounds) together---constant toasting---all while those same people sing a Bruce Springstein song as good as they can for as drunk as they are.    This place is huge -- surely it could fit half the population of Pittsburgh.  It's unique, too, I'll give you that.  And the beer prices aren't half bad!  But let's get real.  I thought two things over and over again when I was here: 1.  Did a frat house rent this place out for a party?  I found out, no..... Says the girl next to me, "It's always like this". 2.  Is this a Tea Party gathering?  Evidence indicates no, it wasn't, so again "it's always like this".

Love it here.  The sheer size of the space, and the pervasiveness and tastefulness of the theme, are impressive enough that I sometimes forget how great the food and drink are.  Their seasonal beers are terrific, and of course the Hefeweisen is a solid standby.  The pretzels will blow your mind, and the sauerbraten, spaetzle, and wursts are all pitch-perfect.  I give it four stars because the size, crowds, and noise can get kind of overwhelming to me - a personal preference, I admit!  I give them lots of credit for stepping outside the wurst-and-kraut standards to provide the schnitzel cordon bleu (which, beware: it's way cheesier than you expect!) and the Heidelberger Rahm Spaetzle, a kind of creamy chicken-and-spaetzle marsala that I order when I don't feel like moving for the next few hours.  I'd say Hofbrauhaus is a must-visit!

If you are looking for a quiet place to enjoy a standard drink, Hofbrauhaus is NOT the place for you.  I mean this place gets loud!  You'll quickly see the crowd standing on their seats, singing and dancing along to the music and enjoying Hof's home brew.  Their lager is good, but I think I prefer their dunkel!  Remember, your choice is 1/2 or full liter, so come prepared to drink!

Use the no wait app. Every time I go to hofbrauhaus, I'm reminded how I want one of those cute costumes for Halloween, etc.!! My favorite part is down in the Biergarten, basically an outdoor riverside bar with picnic tables and walk up service in addition to servers. Everyone loves the pretzels with bier cheese. Over winter, we ate here a few times, and if you love the bier cheese, check out the broccoli and cheese! Yum! They're very easy going with sides substitution. I ordered a schnitzel dish that came with cabbage - which my body doesn't like- and our lovely server helped pick a substitute with a smile!! Bier: yum, I usually stick to the whitest clearest stuff. They serve only their own, the dude has tried nearly all varieties and has yet to leave one to waste!  Ambience, surely everyone's written about: the main hall can be very loud/ downright rambunctious! Live music with chanting and cheers! The more quiet dining room is less decorative, but if you're looking for more traditional family dinner with conversation, opt for this room. The dude and I also enjoy being out on the perimeter tented area.. But you could be right under a speaker...
So fun! We ordered a pretzel appetizer and figured it would be at max 2 pretzels! Came with 4!!! Sit outside and enjoy the view of the river

5 stars all the way!! The servers were cute in their clothing and not slutty in my opinion. I know slutty. I've been to the Tilted Kilt. The place was clean, the service was good, and it wasn't too noisy nor were people disgusting drunk. With that out of the way...  The food was awesome. I heart the hell out of German food, and this did the trick. We shared the sauerkraut balls, which were scrumptious. We each had the Oktoberfest Schweinshaxe, which was colossal and amazing. It looked like a dinosaur leg!! We had leftovers for two days. It came with crackling (a southern thing too, something this southern girl knows about), potato dumpling, and more of that good sauerkraut.   Dessert was the apple strudel for me, and it was superb. I don't remember having the pretzel, though. Darren hogged that. lol. I also loved the Prince Ludwig beer.   All in all, Hofbrahaus is a great addition to South Side Works.

Every time I go to the Hofbrauhaus in Pittsburgh, I'm cool with it.  Its not amazing, but its good.  The bang for the buck is there (even though we didn't buy last night, thanks to a great friend).  We went for a boat ride - a boat ride with grownups only.  There are plenty of spots to tie up, but then you've got to walk into the city to get where you want to be.  SouthSide Works was our go-to last night because of the new marina there.  We tied up, hopped out, and were sitting at a table at Hofbrauhaus within 5 minutes.  Chose to sit outside because the weather was phenomenal.  ~ Use the No-Wait app ~ Sit outside if the weather is good.  Its loud in the main room, and it can be fun, but i prefer it only in the winter for some reason. ~ Get the smaller beer, the big beer glass is wicked heavy ~ They have a Gluten Free menu & a kids menu  And do eat?  I'm a big fan of the Works Sampler to get started.  Its a little bit of everything that you probably want to try.  I like schnitzel, so I prefer the Bauern Schnitzel - put beer cheese & ham on it, all good.  IPA-hole went with Wurstplatte.  I was hoping someone would get the weiner art.  No one did.

I've been here for lunch and dinner, but never for late night shenanigans.  I've always been a fan of the food, and the atmosphere was pleasant (I love the polka music!).  But at night, it turns into a room of music, dancing on the benches, and wall - to - wall people.  It was great!  The only bad thing was that they asked for your ID every single time you ordered a drink at the bar, and you couldn't go get a drink for someone else without them being there.  Great time!

Had a great meal here while visiting for Green Day Concert in March.  We had great service and wonderful huge soft pretzels. Waiter customized a dish for my son and we were seated immediately at prime dinner time.  Only complaint is that they don't have a parking lot and that was challenging. Rest was super.

Went there after a Steeler game. The place was lively and fun. Live german music playing as we walked into the large dining hall. A couple was dancing to the german music. Started with a beer and potatoe pancakes, pierogies , pretzel and potatoe soup. All very good, the potatoe pancakes and soup were over the top. Dinners were good as well, had sauerbraten and pork schnitzel. The family enjoyed the experience, will be back.

Cool place.  Inside was packed and raucous with live music.  Felt like I was in a clean version of Game of Thrones episode!  We were seated outside, which was quieter with nice view.  Food and service was good.

A beautiful place for college kids on a Thursday night during the their college night happy hour. There is live music in the big hall and everyone stands on their chairs with giant beers in hand. Great time! Also, I could live solely on the pretzels and bier cheese!!!

I joined a group here for food and drinks.   I must say that I am a huge fan of German food and culture before I say this is a great place to eat or meet with friends for some beers. The place is huge and on the river with an expansive patio in the back. Unless visiting at peak times, finding a table should be no problem.  Staff members are dressed in German garb and the music is loud, overall creating a small feeling of being in Bavaria.    As expected, the beer is solid.  With whatever type of beer you choose, I suggest going for the 1L mug as it is an awesome feeling to hold that mug filled with so much drink.  My favorite is the hefeweizen, a wheat beer with a citrus taste that is great in summer.  The food is great too from appetizers to main courses.  The pretzels are hot and soft with a real cheese dipping sauce.  There are lots of choices for entrees but one can't go wrong with a wurst platter.  Jagerschnitzel (pork cutlet with mushrooms) is another favorite of mine.  Great place for food, drinks, or both!  Go with a friend or a large group on a warm summer night and you won't want to say "auf wiedersehen!"
Awesomely authentic German bier!

This place is awesome all the way around. From the food to the service to the atmosphere. The music was fun. The beer flight was awesome and really affordable. The menu was very affordable. Great place to come with friends or family for a special occasion or just any day of the week.

decent food, nice place to get a cold delicious beer and some yummy German snacks. i went here right after i rode around Pittsburgh on a rented bike (you can rent them next door), and it hit the spot!

I had a great time & enjoyed the establishment and beverages, until the security individual came over and yelled at us repeatedly.  I understand the importance of public safety, but he was rude, entitled, and belligerent.  I have never been so insulted.  I was hoping to enjoy the evening with my friends, but instead we left at 10:30 because the security guard was so awful.  I'm very disappointed this evening...

Super fun place. You order beer by the liter, need I say more??? The pretzels and beer cheese dip are incredible!  Fun, authentic music and style, all house made brews with a great selection.   We were told it would be a half hour wait, but were able to leave our number and get a text when our table was ready. It didn't even take the 10 mins before we got the text. Our waitress, Kimmy arrived right away and was friendly and quick to smile.  A couple of liters of beer later, bellies full, you can't beat that feeling.

Somehow today was my first time at this Hofbrauhaus. I've been to the Munich and Sydney locations and they have done a good job in Steel Town.  Can't believe how busy it was on a Saturday at 3:00.  There are multiple locations to pull up a chair. There is a smaller room with maybe 20 tables closest to the street, which is the quietest place. The main hall easily has 50 tables and there is an outside deck with maybe another 30 tables. It appears there is another level below the deck but I'm not sure what that is used for.   Service was alright, generally fast but it seems some employees chose clothing maybe a size or two too small. Selection of beer is somewhat disappointing. Four standards and one seasonal that rotates monthly. Really? I've been to much smaller places that can put out better selection than this...   Food was alright, standard fare of Spaetzle, Pretzels, Schnitzel and Burgers. Appetizers are ridiculously priced at $10, but entrees range from $10-20 and seem more reasonable. Sandwiches and burgers are $7-9 and probably the best deal.   My favorite part was observing the German touches. If you have lived in Germany for any time, you will notice things like the picnic tables and silverware/napkins in a stein on the table that are distinctively German.

We had the sampler app which consisted of two pretzels, two potato pancakes, fried pickles (whaaaa?), and some kind of sour kraut ball. It was good. I had pierogis as my main dish and I would advise against it. Hubby had bierwurst. He liked it. Live music and ambience is killer which makes it a "must see" while visiting Pittsburgh. Oh!and BEER!!!!

The covered patio overlooking the river makes for a great lunch spot. There are ceiling fans and you are out of the sun. You can watch boats go by in the river and all the cyclists moving past on the path below. I felt like I was at the German venue in Epcot with the music, the decor, the costumes, etc. Maybe it feels authentic to Germany, too. I wouldn't know because I've never been there.  Warm, soft pretzels are my #1 favorite snack and these were excellent. I would absolutely come again just to have MOAR PRETZELS!  For lunch I had some wurst with mashed potatoes and sauerkraut. All was good.  I tried a flight of all their beers, and they were all fine. Nothing incredibly memorable. Five different things gave me plenty to drink over the course of our meal. Seems like a great place to have fun with friends. I recommend this for a visit.   I'm told it gets very, very loud inside when it is busy, so this would not be great for chatting, unless you sit outside.

Very disappointed that they only take passports for international visitors... Who walks around with their passport!!!  Apparently its a state law... So not entirely their fault... But still. I was very disappointed.

To say it was perfect wouldn't be true.  The beer was great, the food not bad, but how long it took...terrible.  Thanks to Tommy our waiter, he got the manager, whom I did not get her name, delivered our meal and apologized and then took care of it.  We have had good meals before, but service was always quick...I guess it was an off night for them, but the management and server made sure we were treated properly and we will go back.  Thanks Tommy!  We will be back and looking for you!

Pittsburgh's character right here.  Wiener schnitzel with German Potato Salad or sauerkraut is the way to go.   The apfel strudel with Bavarian ice cream is good way to finish your meal.  The employees wear themed costumes. At a certain time every night the restaurant plays live themed music and you can dance on your table/bench (if you're into that).  They also offer 1 liter mugs and 1 to 3 liter boot shaped mugs that can be filled with a beverage of your choice.

The original Hofbrauhaus is phenomenal! You have to sit in the main dining room. It's best on the weekend evening when hefeweizen has been flowing for a bit. The food is traditional German fare. From your standard schnitzel to giant pretzels with beer cheese. You really can't go wrong here. Once the music starts playing, the food is served, and the beer is flowing you will soon find yourself pounding a beer on the table yelling "Prost" out loud with the rest of the diners.  You have to experience this place at least once to understand, but it will be so worth it!

It was love at first sip! The Hafbru Hefe Weizen is my favorite beer here. I've never been a big fan of banana flavor until I enjoyed this beer. The banana flavor is distinct but not over powering. The hint of clover brings about a balance that allows this beer to not be too sweet. This is a savoring beer. Kick back and enjoy!

I absolutely love this place - you can't get better than this in the 'Burgh!  I've always sat outside when going here and I think it's great to be out in the open drinking some good ol' German beer.    Having been to the original Hof in Munich I can tell you it's very authentic.  The food from what I've tasted is good and the beer is delicious - I prefer Hefeweizen's so I can't comment on the other type of beers.     Seeing that this is one of three Hofbrauhaus' in the U.S. (Cincinnatti, Las Vegas, Pittsburgh), Pittsburghers should feel proud to have the opportunity to experience this wonderful place.  So grab some friends and grab a beer at the Hof - and try the pretzels with some beer cheese - delish!

I get to visit the Pittsburgh area about 6 times a year.  Each time I am in town, I want to be here.  Its just a fun place with a fun atmosphere, Oh and the beer is great as well.  I've had some of the food, but I will leave it to others to review the cuisine.  And as far as the different beers go, I think they have something for all tastes.  What I want to get across with my review is the atmosphere here.  I have been there later in the evening when all are just drinking there liter beers and singing along to various tunes including some German ones.  You instantly feel transported to Oktoberfest.  It is something that is hard to replicate but they get it done.  On my last trip here I actually got to sit outside in the Biergarten area.  Incredible.  It was a gorgeous day, so that played a huge part and the river behind you just adds to the Euro feeling.  However, they have a large bar out there, plenty of tables with umbrellas and waitresses.  Oh and the restrooms are close by.  You will not be disappointed coming to the Hofbrauhaus.  I just wish I could stop by more.

Just went here for the first time with my family.  This place is a good time, but if you don't like the idea of an Oktoberfest kind of place with everyone drinking giant liter beers, then don't go here.  The food was good and they really stick to the German types of food.  I had a sampler of some of the wursts and pork roasts.  It was prepared to my liking and tasty.  There wasn't anything that would blow you away, but if you like German food it's a great place.  There were even some things on the menu I've never had before that were fun to try like sauerkraut balls and fried pickles.   I enjoyed their beer as well.  They have a different seasonal brew every month as well as their regulars.  All were good and stick to the German brewing rules.  For comparison though, I liked what I had here better than the similar beers one would find at Gordon Biersch.  Oh yeah, having four people do a shot off a ski in front of the whole place is a good time.  We actually had our kids along and they did great.  Plus the place is so damn loud they can make all the noise they want.  The live music was also a neat experience.  Long story short, I'd like to come back without any kids and get hammered with the crowd there that I can guess gets rowdy as the night goes on.

This restaurant was amazing! My family and I went here for my 21st birthday a couple of days ago and had a blast. Everyone had a good time hanging out in the spacious restaurant. Everyone enjoyed their drinks, and the food was great. I had some kind of schnitzel and loved it. Also, we ordered many appetizers: the pierogis, spinach artichoke dip, and the pretzel. All delicious!   The service was great, our waitress was tentative and made sure everything was in place. Then when it got busier more staff came out to help. The whole time there was live music playing from an accordion! This guy sung in German and enhanced the atmosphere. The only thing I would change about this place is the lack of parking. There was no parking for at least a block around the restaurant. Otherwise, we had a great time and I'd highly recommend it!

It's simple. Hefeweizen brought me here and ham hocks brought my GF here. She eats and I drink. Let's rock and roll.   Food (see pic) (65%)   Taste to Price 4.5/5  Quality to Price 4/5  Portion to Price 5/5  Average = 4.5  Service (20%)    Friendliness 4/5  Promptness 2.5/5  Average = 3.3  Cleanliness (15%)   Bathroom 3/5  Dining area 4/5  Kitchen area 4/5  Average = 3.7  Overall Score = [F(.65)]+[S(.20)]+C(.15)]     = [2.9]+[0.7]+[0.6]      = 4.2  What else to know: I love this place! I'm a huge fan of hefeweizen and other Bavarian style beers. Their hefeweizen on tap was amazing especially with their wheat beer glass. We went here during happy hour so it got busy quick. Understandably service was a little slow but our waitress was very friendly.  For food, we ordered the Knusprige schweinehaxen aka the crispy pork shanks. That thing was huge! As someone said earlier, it's enough to feed 4 people. I'm glad I don't live in Pittsburgh, otherwise I would come here everyday!

While their beer is good the food not so much. I've been a few times but this was the first time I ate here. I don't eat pork so the options are a little limited. I could only imagine as a vegetarian the options are even more limited!   We had the pretzels and beer cheese. The appetizer came with four pretzels definitely enough to share! I also ordered the bourbon chicken and it was just ok. Nothing special actually it tasted like something from Friday's or Applebee's. I also got the Octoberfest beer that was good.  The group I was with ate in the beer hall. There's usually a live band dressed in German garb. But the real entertainment is watching all the people that stand up on the tables to sing while raising their beer mugs!   I'll come back for a beer and to people watch but skip the food.

I have been to the orginal Hofbräuhaus in Muchen, Germany twice and this Pittsburgh replica is dead on considering it's age. The beer is the same formula as Germany however it IS brewed on the premises. You cannot go wrong with German food. The beer is excellent as well. I would recommend this to anyone on the mood for good food and good beer!

This place is awesome. Hofbrauhaus is a must visit. I had a very good time, had some great beer, a nice traditional German meal and enjoyed the ambiance of 500 plus people having their time of their life.  My idea of a Beer Garden is good beer, good food, good signing and good fun. Hofbrauhaus was all this and more. As I walked in this place it was packed to the gills, but you were able to move around. Their was a wait for tables, Plan B the bar. After a few minutes, score bar seats. Let the fun begin; the beer:  Hofbräu Premium Lager was very good with 5.1% alcohol by volume. Lots of body. Nice finish.   Hofbräu Dunkel which was a dark beer with 5.5% alcohol by volume. Lots of flavor with a little spice kick. Also very nice. Lighter than most dark beers.  Hofbräu Hefe Weizen was fruity with a crisp finish. Very traditional and good. Alcohol at 5.1%  The beers were all good. They were easy to drink with lots of different characteristics. Very nice. At $5.50 a half liter, great price.  Ofenfrischer Leberkase - Thick-cut grilled pork and beef loaf topped with a fried egg and served with German potato salad. This was absolutely delicious. The pork and beef loaf was outstanding with great flavors. Never had warm German potato salad and it was a perfect compliment to the saltiness of the meat. Tangy, salty explosion of flavors. Yum. Entree was devour in less than 2 minutes; that is how good it was.  I realize that it was the weekend before Christmas, but this place was amazing with lots of fun had by a huge cross section of customers. It was as welcoming a place can be considering the huge size of the place. At different points in the evening the crowd would be signing along with the music. I know kichy, but FUN. Can't wait for a return visit and enjoy some delicious beer and food. Good job Hofbrauhaus.

This place can get packed.  So be prepared to wait!  However, if the biergarten is open, make sure to check it out.  Great place to grab a beer and wait for a table to open up.  Food here is, blah.  However, that's primarily b/c I hate German food.  Pretzels w/bier cheese are quite good, and make a great appetizer.  Definitely a fun place to have a beer, if you can get a table in the main hall.

Great atmosphere.  Go on the weekend and sit in the brewhouse, order one of the house beers (I prefer the dunkel if you are into dark beers, the hefeweizen if you are into lighter beers) have some great German food and stand on your bench and sing to the accordian music.  ZIGGY ZAGGY ZIGGY ZAGGY AHOY AHOY AHOY.

My first review of 2018, a review I've been putting off because I wanted to give the Hofbrauhaus a second chance. But I can't go back. Was it the food, no, I enjoyed the huge pretzel and variety of flavorful mustards to dip the perfectly crunchy on the outside, chewy on the inside offering was. The beer was fine if that was you next thought. I had a sampling of all their beers which were all different in their own rights.   I'm not a huge fan of the South Side Works, but that wasn't the reason either. It was in fact that this place was over run with college students and it's noisy. I don't dislike college students mind you, it's just that they tend to take over. As I age, the bars I want to frequent need to be quiet, peaceful and if there are Televisions they need to be set to sports or CNBC. Lol.   It's not the fault of this establishment that I don't like the place, it was just built too close to two major campuses in the Burgh.
Great food, great atmosphere, quick service, seated outside, just a wonderful restaurant!  Will go back again someday!!!
Huge portions of delicious food. I've tried many dishes here and I've never been disappointed. The food combined with the ambience makes it a perfect place for a large group.
